hyepXJpdDy73q-JUwnAkOQ.text: Expectations to high! We really wanted to like this place.   The Location is great and the court yard area is wonderful but with that said you have to have great food and staff to back it!  The service was so slow,  the dishes were dirty, and they never came to clear the plates when we were finished.  It seemed like they just were not well trained. The pizza we ordered was just ok our burger came out well done when we ordered it Medium  and the ceaser salad was the blandest worst salad I have ever tasted..   Very over priced for what it is and the options you have to choose from, Maybe this will just be a drinking happy hour place..   - MNSS Review team

z3L2KR10Hz55mhq8u99Gyg.text: While I have eaten here on several occasions, the food is great.  Tonight the food was a great as normal.  Our service in the other hand, dismal.  Our server was clueless and the reason for the 3 stars.   When spending fair money know your role and craft.  When you open a bottle of wine, it is custom to pour a small sample to taste.  Then you pour the the table.  You never just drop the check without asking if dessert  is wanted.   Basic service skills were lacking.   Will probably go back because I like the food, but tonight service makes me need to take pause, service is key in a service business.

-PbxeilGZALKirp-C-ID1g.text: I love this place in every way, great atmosphere, attentive staff, great menu and talented bartender. Love the lounge area for pre-drinks too!

KBuEfD9N_iKVdi4oh3-qcA.text: Visited tonight with a friend.  Upon arriving, I said we should look around.  The attentive host offered a quick tour and we were both impressed by the various and thoughtful spaces for parties and events.  We chose the patio for dinner (gotta love Arizona in December!) and there were several patio heaters that kept us warm.    So, the food:  We tried the warm olive appetizer and cheese plate.  Both were generous portions, very tasty and we did not finish either portion.  We also ordered the mushroom pizza and found it to be very tasty.  Our server, Alyssa, was very attentive and helpful.    So a small criticism may be in order:  I think the entree prices, aside from the pizza prices, are a bit high by 2-3 dollars but they've made a nice investment in our neighborhood, so I guess it is justified, but I'd prefer more affordable entree options.

g60v_7hKdwTCBZo1vRS_Hg.text: This place is cute and quaint. It used to be a plant nursery and the grounds are nicely groomed and there is plenty of parking. We were seated outside on a nice cool evening on a Monday. I ordered the  marguerita  pizza with a white sauce. My friend ordered a Cesar salad and a beer. The food was great, but the ambiance was amazing. Will definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside the restaurant.
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outdoor patio seating with nice view of trees

Aa_TQdK9zTswNa0nbF21vg.text: Thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Pomelo. The rose was icy cold and wonderful. We waited on the charming patio for 30 min and got a table for 6. We came on Friday at 6:30pm w no reservation. With a cold drink and good company, we didnt notice the wait time. A reservation is recommended if you dont want to wait. Food was magnificent. We ordered the bruschetta, they are big and you pick 3 flavors. They were excellent. The margherita pizza. The chefs platter, SO good by the way, and the spinach dip. We had a group of 6 and the food was plenty. Table service was friendly, bartender was kind of dry, not too friendly, just an observation, didnt affect my experience, but wasnt very inviting. People at the bar offered to move over so we could congregate in the bar. It was a friendly vibe. Ambience was nice, it was like a very upscale chain restaurant. Decor and colors were great, but the vibe was still very California pizza kitchen, but the food wasnt, food was much better. The bathroom was cute, good foot photo opp. If you know what I mean, high five . (Cute tile, cute saying, cute photo with cute shoes) didnt get dessert, but would totally next time. Pomelo's was delightful

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Foot photo opp in bathroom
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chefs platter

NCscvc7CH4yDYHVB5T9W_g.text: Best pizza in Phoenix. Friendly service. Seems to be very well managed as it runs like a well oiled machine. Ambiance is wonderful. I like to sit on the patio during the nice weather. As a bonus, there is also a Luci's Healthy Marketplace on the same property. Fun little chotchkies. Five stars.

RkjFHNG73lfg9yaSAY-q9w.text: We came here to see live music from The Henry Co. on a Thursday. We shared the calamari and shrimp fritti, the House Pizza (has chilies, must try if you are a fan of spice!) and a Margherita Pizza.  Pros: Beautiful place, excellent food, live music although I don't know if this is reoccuring.   Cons: Parking sucks. We parked around the corner in a neighborhood. Service is all over the place. Friendly but discombobulated. Lipstick on the glass (stuff happens, no biggie), forgot an appetizer, and just seemed really confused.

fnq2vkdSktx-M4cL9lzyCw.text: This place is close to home and we've  been  anxiously awaiting its grand opening. Four of us arrived in the early evening to a very welcoming staff & were seated on the patio right away. Wings were great & the Polenta Cakes were just ok. We ordered two pizzas and they were both yummy especially the Pepperoni.   The service needs some refinement. We waited longer than usual for just about everything.  Also wet wipes & appetizer plates with wings would be appreciated.   My hopes is they will work out the service kinks soon. Would love to give our neighborhood restaurant five stars, it just wasn't to that level the night of our dining experience.   All the best Pomelo!!!  Worst parking situation now that Luci's is open. Thursday evening & no where to park. Can't imagine the parking on a weekend. Not many alternatives, plan on riding your bike here.

dpAZhSzQDIyK93j-RJnvCg.text: We loved the setting. The grounds are gorgeous! The waitress was very sweet, and our food was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Memorial day dinner at Pomelo!

bTjv-PEI_fH5j7FlNKTrzg.text: So, to start zero issues with our server. She did a great job in a crappy situation.   The problem was the crappy situation. Sat at the bar for ten minutes without a bartender. Again not the servers fault, she was filling in for someone who didn't show up I guess. Food came out cold, they fixed it and I thought it was going to turn around. Then it came time to pay...still waiting which is really the only reason I'm leaving a bad review. Depending on how long it takes this may turn into a short story, perhaps a novel, maybe the literary equivalent in length to war and peace. I've been in restaurants for a lot of years...the situation flat out could have been handled better. I've spent a total 45 minutes of my life now at this point just waiting for someone to take my money.  To end the note: Teriana, 5 stars...Sunday brunch 0 stars.

CNkfY87QNBWztFMFXjk7lw.text: Our first visit tonight left us hoping to try more.  What a nice ambiance, the welcoming grassy area and lovely patio feels farm-like but close to home! We had a calamari/shrimp appetizer that was tasty but small. The burger and fries were good and the dinner salads were satisfying, wish there was some crispy bread especially since there must be a blistering pizza oven somewhere in there!   I look forward to Pomelo developing their website and answering their phone and for the service to get more experienced, smooth and professional. Although the menu is pretty basic, we're going back to enjoy the beautiful space and watch The Orchard grow!   PS - There's a big parking lot at the back of the restaurant, so just keep driving back.

g8Cr96uoTflLKN7S-iuFGg.text: I came here because a dear friend recommended an appetizer (Brussels sprouts) and drink (bellisimio). Both we're just as delicious as described. What was not described is Jess, the bartender. She was absolutely wonderful. I had never been here before so had no idea they had a little cooler situation going on. She took time to explain. She checked in frequently, but not to frequently. She was awesome! I teach customer service for a living, lucky for this restaurant we are not currently hiring or I would have given her a card. Phoenix is a foodies paradise. But what you do not always find us awesome customer service. Pay Jess well. Or you will lose her!!

kblV1niXELp3-cn87FjHYQ.text: I'm hopeful I'll return to give a higher rating -- not because I expect free food, but because of their response.   This place is beautiful! And it's very convenient, situated between where I work and the assisted living residence where my father lives.   I had one fun experience with 20 or so people in a big party. Our food took forever but no one even noticed because it was so much fun. It was only as we were leaving, remarking to each other about how long we'd been there.   My second experience was with my wife, and it was bad. There were kids yelling and screaming in the courtyard. We asked very politely if there was anything they could do, and we felt the response from our server was dismissive and rude. (As parents of four boys 13, 6, 6 and 4, we're pretty tolerant, but we were on date night, trying to enjoy some peace.) The food was passable, but not what we remembered from the night of the party.  I took my father there a few months later, because I often go to Lucy's for breakfast and it's right by his home. I asked the server to surprise me with a signature dish and I gave her some parameters about what I like and was in the mood for (something hearty and savory). She brought me french dip which was blah. The bread seemed like cheap white processed bread, the meat did not taste bad, but it was room temp and not particularly tasty. I asked for a second cup of dip heated up really hot. That helped a bit. My dad hardly tasted his salmon, but didn't say anything. I only noticed when we were ready to leave and I asked to try it. It tasted fishy -- not fresh. Our server was very happy and nice, but a bit over-tasked. Perhaps they had more people than they expected for a summer evening mid-week.  It's a shame because it is so quaint and the setting is outstanding -- and it's in my 'hood.   The reason I will come back is their response. I am starting to write reviews, but it's not my habit. However, I received a "semi-spam" automated invitation to something, and responded just on a whim, expecting it to end up in an unattended mailbox. Instead I got a very nice response.   I don't expect things will turn around on a dime, but I will be back. Their response gave me heart that they're listening, and I choose to assume they're striving to improve because they invested in responding. I'll try again in the fall and let you all know how it goes.

wxlbrV8E9nlPpVYCazUApw.text: Third time I've been here was 12/24/16, Christmas eve.   Every visit, we were seated promptly, waiter/waitress responded with in a minute.   Special request for change of the food item was accepted, when asked, the waiter/waitress offered advice, and were able to describe the dishes without hesitation.      This third visit was a large group and we had a private dinning area.  Other two visits were two of us.  The prices are a bit higher then average, but the food quality and quantity more then make up for the slightly higher price. The ambiance is fantastic, the setting left me speechless the first time I was there and I continue to be impressed by the surroundings.  I will return without hesitation.

QuxP3d1pFEbTSHs1lzdOdQ.text: Amazing space  so unfortunate that the lack of service is suck that t will be awhile we return. Slow slow slow and it took us 45 and 5 tmrw to finally get our checks. Too bad because the space is truly great. Get it together please !

DXyrsQmjEGlD3ah5mdFUAw.text: I have to agree with previous reviewers, the service is pretty bad.  Went in on a Saturday evening, it was not that busy.  I believe our server's name was Dane, although we hardly saw him.  The hostess delivered our wine and a variety of other restaurant employees delivered our appetizer, salad, and entrees.  We were not given any plates for our salads or appetizer.  Water was never refilled.  My salmon was undercooked but there was no one to be found to flag down, so I ate around the raw center.  Other than that, the food is great and the atmosphere is lovely.  Please work on your servers.

Ip-JWtbgrMVZ7j8wPGCXqQ.text: I love pomelo. I love the ambience, whether you sit by the fireplace, at the bar or on the patio surrounded by misters the atmosphere is relaxing hip and chill. My two favorite dishes are the ahi tuna salad and the mushroom pizza. Both incredibly good. Ive ordered them for pick up more than once now. They have a deal if you drink wine, for 20 bucks you get a bottle of wine and a fullsize pizza. The staff have been friendly and helpful each time. I highly tecommend this restaurant for lunch or dinner or just a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pomelo is at the Orchard on 12th street just north of Glendale. Look for the tall water tower on the West side.

2iXYnuvtY2Qt56_F2d74WQ.text: Owners stopped by to visit, food delicious, ambiance great! So nice to have a local place that's good for either a date night or a family outing! Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Went here for my 45th birthday and it was great!

r7xZ6DVOVITpJ2cGo1OIzA.text: We should have read the other reviews before deciding to try Pomelo.  We are fans and regulars of Luci's and visit nearly every week.  We arrived at around 4:30 p.m. on a Saturday because we wanted to avoid the Saturday night dinner crowd, especially because we would be dining with a child.  Because we dine early, we are sensitive to arriving at a shift change when service might be light.  We were seated and that was pretty much it.  We waited and waited.  Because we were in the middle of the restaurant, I could see various servers pass by.  A few even made eye contact.  No one stopped by our table to greet us or to let us know someone would be with us shortly.  By this time, another family arrived and were seated outside.  When I saw that this family had been served their drinks, including an iced tea, I started to get impatient.  When it appeared they were ordering, I informed the hostesses we had not been served since we arrived. Problem solved, right?  Nope.  I watched as one of the hostesses went into the kitchen where the servers were, and it seemed like we would now be served.  Nope.    That's when we left.  On the way out, we ran into the person who appeared to be the manager and informed him we were leaving because we had yet to be served since we arrived.  To his credit, he was very apologetic, offered us a free meal, and offered to serve us personally.  These are all great gestures, but with the frustration that had been caused, we chose to leave and eat at home.    If I had read through the other reviews and saw that this was an abnormal experience, we might have thought about giving it another try and skipped this review.  It's very disappointing to see all of the reviews where this or something similar had previously occurred since it opened about a year ago.  There were even reviews where the experience seemed to have been worse.  I also think about all of the other diners who may have had a similar experience but didn't post a review.  One would think after reading a couple of these reviews, the issues would have been addressed.  Perhaps this review will help improve the service or at least save others from a similar experience.    With all that Pomelo could offer in such a beautiful location and for the sake of other diners, I hope they are able to find staff who are happy and eager to create a positive experience for all who dine there.

QlV29ZqFlvqm2oyS6tG6Ng.text: I want to like this place more than more experience warrants. Parking can be tough as there is so much going on at the site. Good and quick service and the food is very good. I went with a group yesterday and looking around our table, was impressed by everyone's meal. I got the chop salad but the pizza, salmon, burger, and beet salad all looked fabulous. We sat outside and there were flies everywhere - I mean everywhere. Not sure if it's just the time of year but they should probably issue a warning. We're going back next month and will sit inside - then my review will likely warrant four stars.

IPiztImP8edGD7j9Xn5chQ.text: One of the most charming outdoor dining spots in Phoenix, tucked away on a quiet residential street in North Phoenix, an old nursery property has been redeveloped into a destination complex with this restaurant, an ice cream shop and a Luci's marketplace.  Patio is dog-friendly.  Great place to bring kids because there is space for them to stretch, great food, pleasant service.  Their steak salad is the best!

2wVb2eY8Do72qRSxCkFLIg.text: This was our first time dining here on the 26th and we all will be back!   The service & food is amazing (brussel sprouts, spinach dip, pizzas, & salads are all delicious)! Everyone is so friendly and accommodating. We had a group of 7, and I was impressed by the service and food! We were also given a private room because they saw our party was on the larger side. The green room is perfect! We were asked if we wanted music and if the level was okay. The staff pays attention to the details which we all appreciated! They were also happy to split our check at the end which makes it a lot easier for all of us (even though it's more work on their end).  I feel bad I can't remember the hostess and server's names, but I remember their hair (brunette with short hair and a blonde with shoulder length hair). They were phenomenal!   We can't wait to come back again! I'm dying to try the brunch menu next.

suUF47ebejSqmGRkbfNXWQ.text: Great experience!  It's always refreshing and all too rare when you dine at a place where the entire staff clearly are enjoying themselves.  They all seemed to truly enjoy working at Pomelo and their joy extends to their customer interactions.  We were greeted by a very cheerful and friendly host.  And our server (Christy) was awesome!  She expertly guided us through the menu and again, was a pure joy to interact with! The food was fantastic.  Only minor call-out would be the calamari, which just didn't seem as fresh and therefore, didn't match up with the rest of our meal.  The Brussel Sprouts totally lived up to the billing!  Amazing! I had the Salmon and at Christy's suggestion, had it grilled and blackened - wow!  My wife ordered the Short Ribs and they too were incredible!   The entire experience, including the beautiful, warm and inviting surroundings of Pomelo and The Orchard - just awesome!  Can't wait to return.  Kudos to ownership for hiring & training well, and for creating a work environment where your employees clearly come to have fun!

pcNin-EWyVdoxuT_zFJjKQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised at this place had the ribeye sandwich it was fantastic by itself the gravy tasted like it had too much clove or something or whatever it was it was a very overpowering but I love the atmosphere definitely going to try the pizza next time just wasn't a pizza mood that day server was a little short couldn't give me any straight answers about the menu items it was everything in the menu is great and it was my favorite which kind of annoys me be honest just tell me what you really think so I can have an educated opinion other than that the place is great definitely will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

uTzprOkJ7PzK1yd6I0kavw.text: Menu was a little pricey. I ordered the bruschetta which to me was not the greatest.  The bread was cut too thick.  One of the other women at my table ordered the same thing but they brought her one that she had not ordered as you get 3.  She mentioned to our waitress who just ignored her and did not offer to exchange it for what she had ordered.  The service was poor and it took forever for them to bring my order.  Everybody was almost done when I finally got mine.  Then to top it all off they charged everybody in our group and extra $8 for some sort of an extra fee which was unexpected and really uncalled for. They never told us beforehand that they were going to do this. This turned me and many others off.  Had been planning to give it a try sometime for happy hour but no longer.'  One of our ladies ordered a mixed drink which they served her in a plastic glass instead of a real glass.  The best thing is the outside courtyard for dining.  Nice atmosphere.  Otherwise, it would be zero stars.

Tc4xCFSmITi73kTybgvRQA.text: Wife and I tried this place the other day. The interior is really well done. The wood work (trim) is impressive. I ordered a Pomelo Spicy Mule, it was good, different, you could certainly taste the hatch green chili, very good. My wife ordered the Roasted Chicken $18.00  HA! It came to the table and it was a sample piece of chicken. I am not being dramatic, no exaggeration. An entire roasted chicken just about everywhere is at the most $5.99 I'm thinking Costco, any Fry's, perhaps Safeway, a complete whole chicken! This was 2 bites, I didn't want to say anything negative about what she ordered until she couldn't believe what a tiny morsel of food she had in front of her. I ordered the Steak Salad $18.00. It was a small handful of lettuce, excuse me "field greens" and some steak. This could have been a house salad it was so tiny. At this point the wife asked,  "where do you want to go eat?" I was really disappointed, field greens! Put some in a bowl!! The waiter was polite, even though he seemed like he was serving us something to be proud of. I should have got the burger. If you want fancy food and professional wait staff, visit here, if you want a snack this is your place.

S_75nFQQr-SWxWV0u4B2MQ.text: I was very impressed by the care of the owner of this beautiful place.  I was so encouraged by his concern and welcomed the feedback.  Ken was very sincere and agreed that a patron deserves a great experience when coming to his restaurant.  He invited me back anytime to make up for the not so stelar previous experience.  This is a local business whose owner cares about the community so I will go back sometime this month.

4OjNGB8KmhrnQi-zj3bMWA.text: I've always liked this place. Great neighborhood feel. The bar atmosphere is perfect for a quick bite and a drink.  Staff is friendly and you can tell they connect with the regular patrons.

CANJqrmpbUR0LP06xop6kA.text: Went there the other evening for happy hour with a friend.   I go to Luci's, which is in The Orchard and owned by the same owners, all the time for coffee with friends, but decided to try Pomelo's for happy hour since I've never done so prior.  We sat at the bar.  Jeremy was our bartender/server.   I did a taste testing of the red wine on their happy hour menu:  the Monttpelier Pinor Noir and the Los Cardos Cab.  UGHHH!     My friend had the Drumheller chardonnay also off the happy hour menu.   UGHHH!!   Since I like manhattans, I decided to have that instead.  I was told the whiskey used, albeit in a manhattan is not on the happy hour menu and I would have been charged more, was "top shelf," and I was led to believe was a decent one.   Uhmmm.  My head said NO!!  The next day I had a raging headache, a sure sign of cheap booze.   How many manhattans did I have?    Two.   Not anything out of the ordinary.    For food we had the calamari and the spinach dip appetizers from the happy hour menu.   Both were good.  No complaints here.     I would LOVE to LOVE this place since it's locally owned and somewhat close to where I live.   The drinks?   I'd have to order off the regular menu if I was going to have decent wine or drinks.  Does that make it happy hour friendly?   Not for me, but I'd go here all the same.   Jeremy is a great bartender, very professional, accommodating, and friendly.  A truly great addition to this establishment.

FX6uAGyBc1MtsT6UlvuBRA.text: Previously a garden shop and nursery, the same team that opened Luci's Healthy Marketplace has done wonders in turning this into a night spot and restaurant. Because we had a large group, we got the private room at the restaurant. We started with the calamari and shrimp fritti appetizer which was excellent. My 13-year-old went for the margarita pizza and loved the flavors and the basil. My 10-year-old had the kids chicken fingers but switched out the French fries for the roasted garlic mashed potatoes. My mother-in-law and I both had the orchard pork chop with the vegetables and roasted garlic mashed potatoes. My father-in-law ordered the half rack of bbq ribs. I don't even remember what my brother-in-law and his husband ordered (paella maybe?) but we all agreed that everything was delicious and there was very little food left on our plates at the end of the meal.  The service and atmosphere was great as well. Our server, Jessica, was there when we needed her but unobtrusive and professional. She interacted quite well with everyone at the table from the kids to the adults. As for the location, I loved what they have done with the place, there's plenty of room for dining, a full bar, and plenty of parking out back, and even though it was hot, there appeared to be sufficient misters for anyone who might want to sit out on the patio between the various locations including an ice cream shop and a coffee house. This will definitely be a place to which I will be returning. It's a great addition to the North Central Phoenix area.

aiE8D-Ww4dRbdkpNvvh2Dg.text: Great tacos.. and burger.. a must try...their own vodka...smooth and delicious.. Great service, atmosphere.. Beautiful park-like setting. Will definitely be making this a regular..
