rzZ_69vrTSPJdWdqrLYPNg.text: Spent a disappointing New Year's Eve here this year with the prix fixe menu. The glass of champagne to be included was actually Prosecco. Salad was tasteless and we weren't halfway through before our entree appeared. Felt like we were at Chili's! Entrees were ok but the staff started cleaning up as though they were very eager to go home while five tables were seated, some not having even ordered yet. A bus boy propped the front door open in 40-degree weather in order to sweep the lobby and then left it open after putting his broom away. After several minutes, we asked our server if she could please close the front door since it's a small place and was getting very cold, and she said "if he's done sweeping." As if to say his sidework was more important than the customers' comfort while dining? We specifically asked her not to bring out our desserts yet, as we felt we were being seriously rushed through our dinner experience. Once we were finally enjoying our desserts, the staff turned the lights all the way up in the dining room--with four tables still eating their entrees at 9:30pm. I've never felt more shoved out the door in my life--and at a place that ADVERTISED its special NYE dinner! The meal was not worth the $60 and we felt extremely rushed.

-tcF--LqCUI2KGKxvhZ1vg.text: Comfortable. We met w friends for an Anniversary. This place is in a unique place hidden away within a residential area off 12th, North of Glendale. We've been wanting to try it for awhile but never had a chance because of it not being open during the times we have gone and we ended up going to it's counterpart (Luci's). There was a rehearsal dinner going on in the middle of the courtyard which gave me some cute ideas. We were able to get right in w parking at 7:45pm (no valet). We also probably didn't need to make a reservation (even though it was Friday). We ordered the street corn and Brussels sprout apps. I ordered the salmon and my husband ordered the pork chop. Our friend got a salad with salmon. Staff was very attentive. The salmon was cooked perfectly. My favorite thing was that it wasn't overcrowded and stuffy. My least favorite thing was that they were out of the Mahi dish that I really wanted to order. Overall, very comfortable and easy going.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

R9cEvqd5XACR-NQLfKnLAQ.text: Unfortunately, this was our first time eating at the Pomelo, and it happened to be for New Year's eve. They featured The Prix Fixe menu at $60 per person which included a glass of champagne, a starter salad, and your choice of 8-10oz lobster tail or an 8oz filet and dessert, or you could order from other menu selections. My sister and I decided to each order from the fixed menu so we could split the lobster [her] and steak [me].  I ordered my steak medium rare, and it came medium well. Not only that, to both of us the steak tasted fishy/spoiled and it was very dry. I mentioned it to our waitress, and she said she would let her kitchen know. The appetizers were great - calamari and artichoke dip. Everyone else seemed pleased with their entrees: pork chops, salmon and braised short ribs ribs (a little dry). Dessert was also very good. The waitress never again acknowledged our dissatisfaction with the steak, even when she collected our plates and there was still quite a bit of steak left. My son is a server, so I hate to cause a big fuss knowing he has to deal with difficult people, so I didn't push the issue. I guess that's my fault. However, I may wait a while and try this establishment again, if ever. Customer service didn't seem to be a priority.

uX_Rgiwb2CwSXNA-JCeY4w.text: I went to this beautiful establishment last night for my wife's birthday dinner with her mother and father. It was relatively slow with only maybe 5 tables being waited. The setting is beautiful starting with the open walkway and outside seating throughout the surrounding buildings.   As for the food, we started with fried shrimp and calamari which was delightful. The calamari was cooked to perfection which is always a mighty task. We also ordered the baked olives which were tasty however they were just olives warmed up in a small cast iron skillet with oil and garlic. I would recommend adding a side of the grilled banquette they pair with the chefs stone.   For our meals we ordered the Pork Chop (Fantastic!), the House Pizza (Good but pretty spicy / I like spice!), the Mushroom pizza topped with Arugula (good share addition to the table) and the Chef's Stone (appetizer, I think they call it that). All of them were good however the Chef's Stone was overpriced for what you get. Not only that but the plate presentation was a little underwhelming for the $22.00 price tag. I suppose they are hoping people share the tag and the app with smoke and mirrors. Who knows!?   The service seemed a little slow and maybe new but they were smiling and polite so I cannot complain. I will be back.   Also, for my Wife's birthday they did treat us to a piece of chocolate cake with some vanilla caramel with sea salt dessert.  Note : Go on the days where they have Pizza and a Bottle of Wine for $20.00. Now that's a deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Can&#39;t miss the front entrance.
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House Pizza! Love me some spicy!

2H0Py9jJ4VvPLjwNVj77jw.text: This was our second time to Pomelo and was equally enjoyable. Our reservation was honored within 5 minutes and our wait staff was upbeat, cordial and professional. The restaurant is very charming and in a lovely setting, plenty of parking, too. Can't say we experimented much with the menu, just pizzas and salad. In the past, we've have their caesar which was great. Unfortunately, it's not on the menu, probably due to the E coli break out. Hope it comes back. We did see hamburgers go by and they also looked delish. Our Yelp check-in was honored for dessert. Yummy creme brulee.

sSWEWHNlqw6dWk4-bhL6bw.text: Pomelo has potential.   The restaurant is secluded within a neighborhood and has a commune feel with its shared location with Luci's. The courtyard has a lot of greenery and would be a relaxing setting in cooler weather.   The atmosphere in the restaurant is somewhat sterile. The design is simple and safe. With the acoustics and the amount of families, the volume was pretty loud. The vibe certainly seems more yoga mom than hipster.   The staff seemed a little stiff and lacking personality, but there was nothing overtly negative to say about service.   The food is what earns four stars. I had the beet salad and my husband had the crispy chicken sandwich. The portions are modest, but the cooking technique, freshness, and flavor all shine.   All in all, give it a chance. At the very least, the food won't disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beet Salad
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Main Entrance

k2_T6EWa4l4eF7Iuw2AsGA.text: Good service, good pizza (the spicy sausage was fantastic), but ridiculously loud music.  I've only ever been in maybe one restaurant in my life that blasted music near this volume (Joyride Tacos).  The music genre and selections also did not agree with me at all.  It wasn't a relaxing experience, and while the waiter was apologetic and even lowered the music a little for me, it just wasn't a good atmosphere to wind down after a stressful day at work.  Next time I will order my food to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LnZ7V0xkJIGg7mf6uLY11g.text: Went there on Wednesday and enjoyed a wonderful family dinner. The moment we got there we were greeted by Annabelle, with a big smile. We were sat almost immediately. My kids and I enjoyed the best grass fed burgers, pizza, and steak salad. Our server Andrea was awesome! Very friendly and attentive. Loved the place, very inviting. The GM also came to check on our table, which was a nice touch to our experience there. We will definitely be back soon. Thank you!

sB11dzjX9v6deTIlrvWDgA.text: Love the place and the food is pretty good (especially the best salad and the pork chop) but the service is still disjointed. Hostess group confused, and wait staff unsure and untimely. We'll keep trying, but come on man...it's not that hard.

iesPq1ZmAvSDG7YpkhNN9Q.text: Pomelo is awesome. Can get busy in the evenings though, but there is lots to look at in the shop next door while you wait. They have great deals on Tuesdays and Thursdays.

eFAr3rSKjSqn-YI9MuyP2A.text: Great new place. Beautiful outside area. Food was fantastic and service was spot on. Definitely coming back..

PExiiN3B3qj348I0bWqvcA.text: This place is amazing! A lot of parking space so no problem with that! Food is super delicious and service staff is friendly. Can't wait to stop by this coming weekend!

DKo9e-mL-KaRKLijfpAxuw.text: An outdoor birthday party. The misting machines working well, the view of Piestewa Peak was awesome from the grass area. The appetizers (chips, spinach dip, chicken wings, calimari) all were excellent. Granted, we were part of a fairly good sized party, the service was excellent!  Paul and Tony from the bar area were top notch...friendly, knowledgeable,  attentive, timely. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

9it-6mPgO-1EqDB5AoW6Mg.text: Love everything about this place. The food, the ambience, the setting, the staff, the outdoors, wait- did I say the food? Great great place.

pB1QRceRvrjWoLPY8hZ-Ug.text: Great place w neat concept. I have great friends but they are picky and didn't throw off the waitress with their special requests. Very accommodating chef and friendly waiter who didn't miss a thing. Our friends had the burgers and ribs which were juicy and meat fell off the ribs. Ice cream parlour is a must visit and it was great to enjoy the ice cream in the courtyard after. 6 stars!

FcUdZc9hE7thw5bfv5AXGQ.text: I was with Andy G. on Mon. night for my daughters birthday.  I LOVED this restaurant!  I had my pork chop leftovers, (I wasn't going to leave it, it was too delicious.) 2 days later, & they were just as delicious as they were the night I ordered. My prickly pear marg was a hit as well. I will eat here again. For any more info refer to Andy G. I ditto his comment.

AkFRT1vWL0oq_w33_iaMyg.text: The decor, the outdoor area, the food are all wonderful. I'm pretty sure happy hour is only in the bar which is annoying. Either way, will definitely be back.

5I5-6Tz14FzM4qYlRK-awg.text: Pomelo provides a beautiful atmosphere for a quiet dinner or a place for kids to run free. The venue offers a variety of seating and cozy corners to meet everyone's needs. Take time to walk around and explore Splurge and Lucci's.

th5ydPFwjeqTchlJPS9Bjg.text: What a great space - the outside seating is spectacular and the promise of an extraordinary dining experience was on our minds as my wife and I and another couple were seated.  Unfortunately the evening went downhill pretty fast - a hamburger ordered rare and cooked well done, a second glass of wine ordered and arriving after we had been presented with our check, a check that had errors and took forever to get resolved.  The food is mediocre at best, the service is spotty and we will not return anytime soon.  To our server's credit, he did comp the overlooked hamburger but at that point, our perception of this restaurant is great potential but the staff is not trained and the little things that make a difference between average/below average and what makes you want to come back are missing.  Too bad is our assessment.

ftvx-L0LL-pXzQt5oXDW9g.text: Have you ever shown up unannounced to someones house right in the middle of a domestic dispute. No? Well, neither have I, But I would imagine the awkward, unwelcomed "you came at a bad time" feeling is similar to what we felt/experienced.   We enter the establishment to not be greeted by the greeter, but rather were told the "real" host will seat us.  The real host showed up, but rather than say "Hi, welcome" we were handed off to someone else.  It was very awkward as though we were being handed off because we were came at a bad time. We were seated in the bar area, obviously new to the place, so a little lost.  No one, not one person  welcomed us but more importantly no one explained the restaurant, its concept or the menu. Hey folks, new restaurant its probably a good idea to greet and ask "have you been here before?" and follow up with a brief explanation of what we should expect.  Total disaster.

ECAjR8zEctPIMOAURo5q3Q.text: Not impressed at all.  I came to the Orchard for coffee at Luci's during the day and wanted to come back in the evening for a glass of wine by the fire.  They were having a holiday party so the grass area was off limits so we ended up at the restaurant.  First off when we were seated they handed us the happy hour menu so we chose what we wanted and when we ordered it our waitress told us we can't order for the HH menu since we were sitting outside so I said "ok, then why did you give us the HH menu?" She said it's the only menu they have with their cocktails listed on it and what's in them.  So that was really annoying.  Then later I asked for a knife for our fig spread, granted we had no utensils or napkins at all, and she came back with a spoon and said they didn't have anymore knives...wow, really?!?! So we had our bottle of wine corked and paid the bill and left.  They just didn't seem to be very accommodating or professional overall it definitely did not leave a good impression.

U4AxhtYd2wTyQ7NCOojRwA.text: My wife and I took some friends, who were visting from out of town, to Pomelo for brunch this past Sunday. This was our first time so we were excited to try it. Long story short, we probably won't be back. The food wasn't bad, but the service was absolutely horrible.  Our server was so slow that he almost seemed lost or confused. Our food came before our drinks even though we ordered drinks well before our food. Nothing came out together and we had to ask multiple times for various items. We tried to enlist the help of someone who appeared to be a manager, but she seemed annoyed that we had the audacity to even say anything. She basically didn't listen to what we said and snapped back that she was "on it". Let me tell you she was anything but "on it". She was flat out rude. Overall the entire experience was a bust and slightly embarrassing considering we took friends there from out of town.

j9Fvuyp4n9JSMDVy1ODIcA.text: Such a fantastic celebration for Grandpa Fred's 90th birthday! Linda was absolutely wonderful. The food was delicious! !! We can't wait until the next party. Thanks again for the amazing service and lovely atmosphere!

uOD4GxbnHtgU5N4f62IjFg.text: Not outstanding. Service was poor. We did not get  items or drinks we ordered. They were out of dessert. Food was bland. Spicy fettuccini had no spicy flavor.  Spinach dip was nothing special. Loud. Pretty setting. Not worth a long distance trip.

zmyYpk_bSK9Mw2q9qC77XA.text: I have to say first off, what a beautiful place this is. I'm sadden by the cruel reviews that some people have posted. It takes so much to put a project like this together and no, it's not perfect but you can see how much care that has been put in to make it great! People need give them time to work things out... Clearly some expect perfection when we all know-that simply doesn't exist! Be a community that supports and builds up, not tears down! Someone made a cruel comment about "the lady in the gray dress" I too was there and saw her... She never stopped moving and made a point to approach and talk with many customers including me, asking if I was enjoying my time. Best of luck to you Pomelo. I wish you all great success!

d5zKpF_A0apEmpqv6zqwXQ.text: I SOOO wanted to enjoy the experience more than we have on two of the three occasions we've been here for dinner. The grounds are lovely and the concept fresh, but food and service so inconsistent that it's hard to know what to expect.   Our telephone contact for reservations was super all three times! Really, here's an area where the management really shines, as in giving warm and welcoming first contact. Unfortunately, not so warm and welcoming after that, although we were greeted pleasantly and seated promptly, which isn't always so easy to accomplish.   We had reservations for six at six o'clock to accommodate finals-week schedules of the teens in our family, so I'm not thinking we just hit the staff at the end of an exhausting holiday-week dinner shift. Short story: (1) 10-15 minutes before any contact with a server and that only b/c we flagged down the hostess as she whizzed past, (2) absolutely no overview of the menu or personal interaction with our server, mainly menus passed out and orders jotted down, (3) no follow up or even eye contact during dinner, (4) no suggestion of coffee or dessert, which we might have considered since this was a birthday dinner. However, by then we were sliding into indifference, so left a modest tip and zipped off for hugs in the parking lot. The front desk staff was busy when we left, so the server, possibly inexperienced and certainly not-so-well-trained, may have wondered why we didn't recognize her efforts.   The most pleasant interaction of the evening was with a guy who delivered some of our dishes and chatted up our 14-year old about where on earth he was planning to put that gigantic hamburger! He even paused a moment later in the meal to express amazement at the clean plate. This 2-minute exchange was more what you might expect from a nice mid-range restaurant.   The food was okay, nothing special, and certainly nothing to compare with the setting. Pomelo, and certainly The Orchard as a whole, potentially has more to offer than some of the restaurants only a bit further south on 7th street, where both food and service keep us coming back. I haven't given up on Pomelo, but will be awhile til we try again.

Yj7SBJZbc_NJgC9XKLvWkQ.text: We've been waiting for this place to open for months! And we are pretty happy with it. The Bellissimo cocktail is SO yummy. I have ordered it every time I've been there (which has been 4 times in less than 2 weeks.) Also, the food is good. Nothing crazy outrageous amazing, but very good. I've had the spinach dip, the wings (really saucy, but great grilled) and the burger with fries. Staff are very friendly and abundant. The hostesses have been overly positive and pleasant. We've had super slow service a few times, but I expect that in the first month when a place is trying to get their flow figured out. I would like to think that this place will do well for a long time if they get their service/food times figured out. The neighborhood has been dying for a cute spot like this! I can't wait for the other places to open up at The Orchard. We can walk to this place from our house, so it  will be a popular destination this summer for ice cream and splash pad. Try to Uber/Lyft there on busy nights...the parking lot fills up and you may have to park on a nearby street. I heard that some folks in the area are already upset about cars parking on their streets, but there isn't much they can do about it.

i0M_CS1cd3Uuz0EQ2ZHvAw.text: My husband and I have eaten here several times, at the bar, for brunch and lunch.  We had good service and enjoyed our meals so decided to take out of state visitors on Sunday for a late lunch.  Terrible decision!  Seated promptly in the dining room, server brought water and took drink orders, two cokes, one iced tea and one Bloody Mary.  When three of the drinks were delivered we placed our food order.  The place was not crowded and it did not appear they were short of staff.  Nevertheless, our food, one omelette, one chicken sandwich, one tuna tartare and one chicken enchilada took nearly 45 minutes to be delivered.  Still no Bloody Mary.  And the server never appeared again until we looked for her to bring our check.  Finally a manager type person asked how our food was which was when we mentioned the Bloody Mary.  It was promptly delivered.  The food was fine, but the tuna tartare with guacamole was just not a good combination.    We will return, eat at the bar and enjoy their brunch menu, but will likely visit other places first.

3ctxhB2N5_Ja2NUUNnsFIw.text: L.O.V.E. This place is amazing! Food is great, service is awesome, location is great, outdoor ambiance is stellar, kid-friendly to the max (can you say splash pad?!?! Yes- they have one for the kids and the restaurant encouraged them going in it while we were there dining!!).  All in all- this is my new favorite place in the valley. Love it!!!!!

aB7ezPOrrHQnG84eiNThiw.text: Pomelo and Luci's at the Orchard is an absolutely beautiful space. We went for dinner on a Saturday night and had a terrific experience. Great service and the food was amazing. We will be back!

ZdkuvBLGJPkEq-FfBUrnjg.text: The Orchard is a gem in Uptown Phoenix. We decided to go there to try it as a special night out. Where an actual orchard was they really did a fantastic job turning this orchard house into a really nice restaurant.  The cocktails are craft in nature and there us a nice bar.  Lots of interesting choices and many beer and wine choices too.  The menu is very good - check it out online!  We had a terrific dinner and your could definitely tell that they use as much local produce as possible because it was great.  I think what I found the most remarkable was the exceptional staff.  From the moment we came through the door and were greeted by the hostess to our waiter and bus staff who were so gracious, helpful and welcoming.  The place is really a sweet restaurant.

eBaGJ6ehI0J8AyoVESww6Q.text: I'm giving it five stars because the service was absolutely exceptional, one of the best servers I've had in a long time; however the cobbler was very under cooked but the server replaced it immediately and the second one was awesome. If you go in ask for Justin, he was a hoot.

20XGa3EJ7k-eZXreHh99kg.text: Food looked pretty enticing,  however I was not impressed by the food  nor the amout I paid for it. Made choice to sit inside, yet there were still Flies inside and I immediately  was turned off and somewhat grossed out. Aaron our server was good sport and tried to accommodate.

osSbpSdLt91LK4EZWyICfQ.text: Went for a quick lunch during a work day.  Mark was our server.  He took drink orders, delivered them promptly and left.  He never returned on his own to inquire about our lunch order.  Mark even walked back and forth past our table slowly, countless times - even making eye contact with us, but never stopping at the table.  I assumed he was a busser who just took the drink orders and that our server would be by to take our food order.  With 20 minutes of my lunch hour quickly disappearing and no food on the horizon I stopped a hostess who was cleaning the table next to us and asked if she could find whomever was our server and send them over to take our order.  Surprisingly the young man (Mark) who served our drinks shows up.  He took our order and left, never offering to refill our drinks or replace the cocktails with new ones.  After another 15 - 20min our food arrived (a cold vegetarian bruschetta board and an ahi tuna salad).  My two friends had mentioned that they intended to share the ahi salad when they ordered it, but no share plate was provided.  We had to ask the young lady who delivered the food to bring a plate.  Mark returned with a plate.  At this point - roughly 45 minutes into my lunch hour - I asked Mark for a refill on my iced tea and my check, explaining to him that I hadn't anticipated the lunch to take so long.  He returned with my check, but no iced tea.  Without making this review last too long, it took 4 reminders for Mark to bring me the iced tea.   Bottom line, the service was very slow and borderline awful.  Beyond that, the bruschetta board was not great.  All three selections were very dry(hence my persistence on an iced tea refill).  My friends enjoyed the ahi salad quite a bit.  Because neither the service, nor my food were anything worth re-living, I won't be back.  And I can't honestly recommend this spot to anyone.  Sorry!

SdrHad0gDmrTWnnsm52GzQ.text: The best Halibut I have EVER had, surrounded by roasted veggies on top of saffron rice. Amazing space for dinner and relaxing with friends. One tiny recommendation please dim all those beautiful lights inside the restaurant to create some cozy ambiance.

QIqoXHqfmu_WmN-hUe_u5A.text: After looking for a new place to eat, we found Pomelo. Keep your eyes peeled or you will miss it. The Wife and I started with some drinks, they were strong and good. Then we shared the spinach dip. It was very good; cheesy, bubbly, and tastey. For dinner my Wife tried the pepperoni pizza and I ordered the burger with fries. Her pizza was the hit of the night. The pepperonis were crispy and the pizza had an excellent wood fired taste. My burger was just ok. It was a grass fed beef burger(which I have never had before) so maybe that was the reason it was lacking in flavor. I tried to put ketchup on each bite and that helped, I also tried sprinkling salt on it and it helped a little too. Maybe grass fed beef is not my cup of tea.  All and all we had a great experience! Service was on point and everything came out as ordered. I would like to go back and give them another try to make me something else.

Jvln2AuyZaJLQF_p4jiF-Q.text: Amazing food, and lots of gluten-free options! Very attentive and friendly service. Good is a little pricey, but tastes incredible! Will definitely be back soon.

MM5mkl0RhA_3KIUoGr6msQ.text: This is a wonderful, well run restaurant. I have tried a number of the items on the menu and loved them all. The pizza is especially great. The service is excellent.

mVaElniU0GBHihGvN88JbA.text: I was looking forward to trying out this new place and have mixed feelings. The service was outstanding, food was delicious but the thing that really brought my review down is the ambient sound level. The dining room only holds about 50 people but I really had to strain to hear my friend across the table from me and felt like I was almost yelling to be heard. I'm not sure why this is such a reoccurring theme for restaurants...no thought to sound control. In any case, I think if I hadn't been there in the middle of the day, during the heat of the day, I would have sat outside and had a much better experience. Certainly something to try then I won't have to strain to hear and be heard while I enjoy a great meal.

j63NYoLc44zvR4mCYwnXMg.text: Very cute and comfortable. Food is delicious! I had the Pomelo Benedict, hollandaise sauce was on point. Also we had two mimosas for $5 each. Delicious. Will return.

xNueHOAlkMpxxLJ4TADIBw.text: Upon learning about our experience at Pomelo through a mutual friend, the owner personally reached out to my husband and I. He apologized for our experiences and mentioned a few reasons why his restaurant was not where it should have been. Owning my own business I know your only as good as your staff. He mentioned he had some staffing issues and since then he has personally focused on bringing the right people in to change the way they do things. He offered dinner on him just to go back and give it try. Just because we got a free dinner is not why I am changing my review. I'm changing it because not only did the owner personally reach out and try to make a wrong or right but we truly did have a wonderful experience going back.  The food was delicious and the atmosphere is always amazing. I let a few bad experiences make me believe it just wasn't a good restaurant but I was incorrect. I would refer this restaurant to anyone who is looking for an amazing place to experience amazing food with an amazing atmosphere. * excuse the typos

3Z8rRIgkzeNFJVHzrLVV1w.text: Chad was amazing. Hard to believe that we had such Personal AND amazing service along with a great meal. If you like spicy, try the Pomelo Mule for a great drink and the spicy Fettuccini. Very satisfied

qg714S9V5wzJcDIdTIV6SQ.text: This concept is going to be great!  Beautiful, really beautiful grounds and perfect for groups and families!  Pomelo restaurant was very good, food was on point, and service was excellent!  Our waitress actually took the time to show me a bottle of the tonic used to make the Carl Stuart Gin drink because I was curious about the ingredients!!  Can't wait til everything is open here and brunch!!!

qc_eCKPTvTZ-n8awAzVJSg.text: This was my 3rd or 4th visit. I've had a couple of good experiences in the past, but this night was the exception. As much as I enjoyed the food, the service was so-so. Our waitress was very sweet, but not very attentive. And we were NOT a high maintenance crowd? It took SO long just to get our water glasses after being seated. Then we didn't see our server for the longest time and wanted to start quickly with appetizers for those of us who were hungry.  When I asked another waitress if we could order appetizers, she was seemed a bit bothered and said she would get my server. A simple "Yes! I would be happy to find your server and she will be right with you" would have been nice. One of us ordered a glass wine as we were eating our appetizers. The wine did not arrive until he was halfway through his dinner. We had to ask where it was! How long does it take to bring one wine glass? Then the birthday boy requested a custom dessert....simply, vanilla ice cream with whipped cream on top, drizzled with chocolate sauce. The waitress went to check and said they ran out of ice cream and didn't have any whipping cream. (I'm sure he would have been happy with just the ice cream and chocolate sauce. Guess the kitchen couldn't handle that) She suggested we walk across the grass area to get ice cream at the gelato counter. Hmmmm, guess it was too much bother for our server to get more ice cream across the way. As we were getting ready to leave, someone asked for a container for 1/2 the ribs he didn't eat. She brought a container that barely fit one rib! And then she  disappeared so we decided to find a suitable container ourselves. Again, a very sweet person, but she and the other young female server I mentioned need some training in timing and checking back with us more frequently. If we decide to return I hope the service improves. There's nothing more annoying than trying to enjoy a birthday celebration with friends and having to search for your server.

5HChlK13rGctvhMwUfgIAg.text: The server recommended the roasted brussel sprouts, which we couldn't eat because they were practically raw. The wine we were served was a different year than the one on the menu, which isn't a bid deal, but we were literally laughed at when we asked about it. We had to ask to have our water refilled and another wine glass brought. Our server brought the check and we had to ask about dessert. He said them so fast that we had no idea what was being offered, so we paid and left. I can't imagine Pomelo lasting in this lovely location if this is the quality of experience it offers.

hosu2hIg06RE224fMbsp3w.text: The food was good, but the service was horrible that's why I'm giving this place 2 stars. Went without water for 20 mins, finally had to get a server to get our server for our check and a box. Will not be coming here again. Nor will I send people here. Even when our server did come to our table, he didn't offer any water while we check out. Sucks!! But hey, you live and learn

lUHiLvwSqho9vrvj5wu9DA.text: Incredible ambiance.  Such a beautiful design.  The service staff, cooks, and bartenders are on point.  Definitely coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

dTYcw736cpp_kNWyr-kKuA.text: I had my engagement party here. Everything was great prior. Meeting with the event coordinator, the food, experience, etc. I was told not to worry about a thing! Drop off your decorations and everything will be handled. I show up the day of my party and NOTHING is completed. My balloons are all just sitting there, all my decorations are just in a box, and no one seemed to care. I tried calling and calling who was in charge and nothing. Then, when I still had about an hour of my party left, the event staff started breaking down my party and moving it making my guests feel like that had to leave (which some did.) I understood another party was being set up for but then do not make my party part of that area, the situation could of been avoided! My fiance and I were so upset, we left and took our party down the street the the yard. I then reached out to the event coordinator to express my concerns and she told me she would get back to me then just never did. I am sure this place is great just for dining and mingling, but don't do a party here.

H4IbOVV3IFuQlRosV-LANQ.text: Pomelo can please any aspect or taste. Intimate and friendly bar with a beautiful dining room. The outside presents abundant seating and a intament glow in the evening.  Attached are Luci's Orchard Splurge ice cream shop and a drive through coffee venue. All of the venues are fantastic! Great family place and kids are welcomed with open arms...

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

2Fgg9jqQYpfGt2xpaiyiVA.text: Great staff friendly bar tenders and nice location.  really good patio. So with all that being said it is a solid place for lunch or dinner.

QP06uANMevahvOWoXobQvg.text: This was our first time here and just loved our experience.  The service was excellent, food amazing and beautiful surroundings.  I on returning.

26GUQVQDY9cIIepCWqtfKg.text: The environment was very chic, however, the service was substandard.  I ordered a dish and after waiting almost 45 minutes, I finally asked a server (my server was nowhere to be found) about my meal.  After another 10 minutes, my server finally showed up and attempted to shift responsibility onto the chef, claiming that the chef ran out of the key ingredients for my dish. My server then claimed that he had attempted to pass this message on to someone else to inform me, but they did not.  Between all of this, I also reminded them I had not received the iced tea which had been taken away to be refilled.  The server flippantly shifted the blame upon one of my dining companions, saying that they must have taken my drink.   What an odd situation, I thought... Here I was waiting for my dish for much longer than expected, and it seemed that nobody was responsible for the wait... It was merely bad fortune, the server seemed to think.  The server then offered me an appetizer or a salad, I chose a salad, optimistically believing the restaurant would make it right and offer it on the house.  Not so, I learned later on.  In the end, I waited an hour for an overpriced salad and had to deal with a server who missed the mark on an opportunity to salvage the experience.

q45K77rRMkbDc6Z9ZJSq9w.text: The wait staff is phenomenal and atmosphere is charming.  My salmon was perfectly roasted but a touch too salty for my taste.  My husband had the pan roasted chicken and it was moist and tasty.    We unlocked the free dessert offer for checking into Yelp (even though our server had no clue what the offer was ... she brought my phone to the manager).   The crime brulee was heavenly!!   The best part of the meal!

EApQWerazMGap2YH98LrLg.text: We wanted to go somewhere new for a girls night so we picked Pomelo. What a great choice! Just walking in was a fantastic because of the setting with the fire pit and lights strung throughout the outer area. It looks like a little village with the other restaurants which we found out were all connected by owners. The food was great too. The Brussels sprouts are the best we have had. We also shared the beet salad and Harvest Salad. The bar area looked like a great chill place to just come and have a drink. The owner stopped by our table and gave us the history too. Kristy was our server and she was great too. Can't wait to go back!

mD6vtVrRen_h2tsPUEQnZA.text: We all loved it!  The specialty cocktails, pizza, harvest salad, burger,  and fettuccine... excellent! Don't skip dessert!!!!!

b-xTVcXl9UWZPVap1ftIQg.text: Came here for brunch. Started with the cinnamon roll which was absolutely delicious.  The place is within a larger place called Luci's at the orchard.  Very beautiful place, great atmosphere. The food is fresh and high quality. This is definitely a spot you wanna go to for brunch.

hs6ILUJ-nN_NM0TOZL9igQ.text: Love the setting and the place has great potential but most things fell short for us. The host was scrambling trying to direct the staff on where to take the party in front of us and it took several minutes of us just standing there before he acknowledged us and said he would be right with us. Our waiter took our drink order for half of the table and then left. Only when he came back 15 minutes later did he take the remaining drink orders. Never check on us once during our meal. Had to take our check up the host since our waiter never came back to our table once the food came. Food was okay at best. Beet salad was decent,  french dip had very little meat on it. Nothing worth going back for in my opinion.

wskEwSID6LR2qzJBTyt3YQ.text: This is a really nice place.  There are three or four buildings on the property and the first to open is Pomelo.  As you walk in the bar is off to one side and then there's a good-sized dining room and a nice patio with misters.  The cheeseburger and fries were very good.  I'm guessing the fries are made fresh in-house and not frozen which was much appreciated.  Service was very good.  In fact, there were a ton of servers and assistants taking care of the guests and anticipating your needs instead of waiting to be asked for small things like drink refills.  This was very impressive.  The only thing that I wasn't wild about was how loud the dining room was during my lunch.  There are a lot of hard surfaces in the dining room and the sound really reverberated.  All in all it was a nice experience.  I'll definitely come back for another meal and to see how this project evolves.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cool sink and soap dispensers
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheeseburger
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice setting

5JLB76rW-HS4tu_IYY00Zg.text: Hello I am a loving husband and father of one. I recently got a pay raise so I took it upon myself to go to Pomelo's. I loved it, my wife loved it, and my daughter loved it. The queasiness were spectacular.It is a real good place to go for lunch or dinner. I strongly recommend it.

57qScM1VB3_3ECV-RcNjlg.text: Mainly, why did you change the happy hour hours to end at 5!?!? This was our neighborhood stop during the week but not if the hh ends at 5.  We love this place. It's great. Bar is awesome. But the recent change on the hh put a damper to my love.

VjXsg335O_wKo69CSG5gUg.text: We were visiting Phoenix with some friends and decided to try Pomelo. All the food sounded amazing, it was hard to choose. 1 person got the pulled pork tacos. They were really good. 3 of us went with the crispy chicken sandwich. It was good but only one sandwich had the sauce that resembled thousand island on it, which was a bummer. I did really like that they had a hot sauce dipping on the side. The fries were AMAZING! The drinks (mimosa and margarita) were AMAZING! It seemed like we were the only table that wasn't served water, but when I asked for water they offered a Togo cup which was cool. If I ever go back I'd definitely try something else or make sure the crispy chicken was smothered in sauce. Also our waitress was very kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_lQeGdq4o_vDWAOMdgcpng.text: This is an update to my previous review. Awhile back I was invited back by Pomelo's to try the Chilaquiles again so hubby and I decided to go for brunch today. We were greeted promptly and were quickly lead to a corner booth which was perfect. We both decided to take advantage of their $5 Bloody Mary's. They were very good although a tad bit spicy for my taste. Hubby loved his though! I ordered the Chilaquiles and hubby ordered the French dip with french fries. This time around the Chilaquiles were 100% better. The pork was very tender and flavorful and I had no problem cutting it with a fork. The eggs were nice and fluffy and I liked finding the potatoes on the bottom that I hadn't even noticed before. There was just the right amount of salsa and sour cream layered on top and before I knew it I was stuffed. Hubby's French Dip was very tasty. The meat was cooked perfect and the roll was very soft. The french fries were nice and crispy and piping hot. We both very much enjoyed our brunch and we will definitely return as I would love to try the Ahi Tuna and the French Toast next time around!  Previous Review below:  I went here with one of my meet up groups for brunch. I'm really sad to have to do it but I have to honestly say that it just wasn't that great. Two of us ordered the Chilaquiles and I ended up sending mine back as it was inedible. The pork was so bad. It was tough and fatty and the gristle made me need to spit it out in my napkin. It  did not feel or taste like it had been hardly cooked at all. So I went ahead and ordered their breakfast pizza and that was pretty good. One of my friends had ordered the breakfast enchiladas and she said they were not very good either and were not something she would ever order again. The $5 cocktails they have for brunch (mimosas and white sangria) were very tasty though! The waitress we had was very nice as was the manager who came out to apologize for the chilaquiles. So I don't know as if I would return to this place for brunch but I do feel like I would give it another try for lunch someday.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French Dip with French fries
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chilaquiles

t1GI2I4n3V3WURKshgmnOA.text: This place looked amazing, especially after having visited Lucy's next door so we tried it out for lunch today with our kids. The staff is very attentive, at least 4 people come up to make sure we were being helped when we were waiting for our table.   Tried the beet salad and Caesar salad. No flavor at all!!! No seasonings on anything on the salad or salad dressing of any kind on either, very disappointed! The Cesar was so bad I had to send it back.   The pizza was great though, we did the mushroom pie and it was amazing.  All in all we would come back but only for the pizza. If you try this place and venture for a salad, ask for extra dressing on the side! YOU WILL NEED IT!

rpA2OAwlpt2PYjjBudXfMw.text: Place was ok. Very expensive for a brick oven pizza. However I got the burger and substituted it for grilled chicken instead of beef and it really didn't have any flavor, a friend of mine got the burger with Abby and also said his didn't have any flavor so... there you have it

q_6JqGq9WI-pBuATydP9rg.text: Wow! Pomelo has won the heart of this self professed pizza snob. It is DELISH. The texture is on point with crispy edges and soft-ish crust. The toppings, sausage and onion, are full of flavor and pair well with their perfect mozzarella. Our server seemed to know exactly what we needed without being overbearing; the managers , Matthew and Michelle, were so kind and welcoming. Not sure you can do much better in the ambiance category than Pomelo- hands down the BEST patio in Uptown. Thanks for a great Friday date night. We will be back, soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Savannah LOVES Pomelo&#39;s pizza!

q9yhkC_TefRJPzj53TXU6g.text: I can't say enough about this place, it's perfect for any occasion with two different dining options to choose from. A nice sit down restaurant/bar with a phenomenal menu or a more laid back order at the counter and find a spot inside or out on the patio to relax. Beautiful grounds and lush scenery makes it a great place to hang out with the family or with friends and enjoy good food. Plenty of room for kids to run around and play complete with a splash pad and sweet shop too. What more can you ask for!

Uop2FoumOt8Pl0cK6HQJ4Q.text: This place is located on a quaint area right behind Lucy's. Tucked right behind some trees, so not super easy to see right at first, but I think that's what makes it special. It is definitely an awesome place to grab a bite... Not only the ambiance, courtesy of a nice patio with comfy chairs, but also, great their great service, & even greater food! I ordered the Pork Lollipops from the appetizer menu, and I was not dissapppointed at all. It was such a nice portion that I no longer needed a main dish. Very filling! It comes with an Arugula salad topping along with some very tasty orange-like Pepperocinis. I also got their street corn, which was very authentic, and off course a margarita. The Prickly pear is a very lovely pink color so it was not only delicious, but good to look at. Overall I had a nice time and would love to be back.

4hqCbl7U38NhiGX0xfYKlA.text: Girls night at Pomelo's and it was so nice! There was a beautiful white tent outside with chandeliers for a private event but we can see into it nicely. It was very romantic and we didn't need our husbands to enjoy this evening! The managers stopped by to chat and check up on us. The restaurant had a relaxed and comfortable ambience. Our food was good! We had the calamari, spinach dip, Brussels sprouts, grilled corn for appetizers. We all enjoyed it except some of the portions were tiny, ie the corn. A few of the main dishes we tried were the mushroom pizza, shrimp fettuccine and the braised short rib. These three dishes tasted very good except the fettuccine got cold and hard quickly. But we still ate it all up. Our waitress was super friendly and patient. She dealt with our splitting of the checks with finesse. Lovely first time at Pomelo's. Will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vR5fo7213vUrLMI-p1VVZw.text: This is one of my favorite places in Arizona.  They have an unbelievable patio and it is the perfect place to go for any occasion.    The ribs are phenomenal as well as the pizza. This is a definite recommendation any time you want to eat out.    Be sure to leave some extra time to walk around and check out the grounds.  It's a fun hang out.

hXX9G18NAiRqhRrS_HjSrQ.text: I recently met some friends at Pomelo for dinner on a Sunday night. We arrived a little before 9 o'clock and were aware of the restaurant closing at 10. We planned to eat and visit, but not stay all night. I was very disappointed by how the wait staff rushed us along through the whole meal.... trying to clear drinks and food before we were finished with them. At one point, a busser/server rambled on to a co- worker about how tired he was as he cleared our table. Not long after that, the manager came out and babbled on to us about a 10:15 city ordinance and how we basically needed to leave....as though we were a loud table of drunks. He made sure to tell us it was 10...like you need to be out of here in 15 minutes...I was like really??? None of us had more than one drink and we were just enjoying regular conversation. I felt that was very unnecessary and rude. There is no excuse for treating customers that way. Maybe they should consider closing at 9 since customers showing up then irritate the staff. Neither my friends nor I have a desire to return since we were made to feel like a nuisance for going to eat at Pomelo.

PKssbUihB3uL_uXJLbIaOg.text: My 2 previous reviews of this restaurant were not flattering. The food was bland, prepared badly or inconsistently. The brunch menu was also sorely lacking.  I'm so pleased with the changes I've seen. Went for Sunday brunch and it was great. They've done a nice expansion of the breakfast items on their menu (thank you!) and the food and  service were perfection. I'm hoping our experience will be the norm on our future visits. So happy to see these improvements!

Dq0JN5dzDurUQItNNzWtiA.text: The whole Orchard area is absolutely adorable.  We had an early dinner at Pomelo and were able to sit outside by the fire.  Service was great and the food was amazing!  This place is all about the ambience in my opinion but the food quality made it that much better.  Definitely recommend this place for a fun, laid back night out.

TWMAhvWQMGB25noz8jVc4A.text: Sunday Brunch...our three breakfast items served just room temperature, NOT even hot; breakfast potatoes seemed like they are previously cooked, NOT even worth to pay extra for it; poach eggs on the Egg Benedict are firm, NOT soft; the Smoke Bacon tastes good but just NOT freshly hot again...all in all, nothing special about the place, no need to hurry back! Go to Luci's across the way instead

y5p9ftIjYdF713dw_5GFBg.text: Wow. Ordered two house pizzas and a Ceasar salad for take out. I found this place on Yelp, looking for anything new (and decent) in Phoenix to eat. I was surprised when I arrived to see where this joint was located. I had assumed it would be on the corner at the light but it was mid block. I must say they did a incredible job with the lighting and landscape of this place. I was even more impressed when I finally located the entrance -- by this time I'd walked the entire perimeter I think. Tip: don't park in front as you first turn into the lot, thinking you have hit the jackpot with being so fortunate to have pulled in at just the right moment... because the entrance to the restaurant is accessed from the rear p-lot. Lol.  I cannot comment on the service or staff, as I ordered my food for pick up. The girl that took my order when i called it in was plesant. I can say that the order was ready and waiting when I arrived and it was complete. There were no hang ups or mix ups. I give Pomelo five stars for the quality and taste of the food. Everything was perfect. Yes, I realize it was only pizza and a salad but... it was hands down, the best I've yet to have in Phoenix in my twelve years living in this city. Next time I will dine in and see if the staff and service measures up to the food they serve? I hope so.

iM0yxdcTvLN8YYpucn8lKQ.text: My daughter's bridal shower was held at Pomelo in a lovely room that had booths, sofas, a fireplace and huge brass chandelier.  The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful, they met our every need.  We had a separate room for the delicious food they served.  I am so pleased we chose Pomelo for this special event, and we will certainly be returning to dine there.

4pDUtJuIOJYk2h7q4kNn7Q.text: Wonderful ambiance.  The food is just off.  We really couldn't eat anything we ordered.  It wasn't prepared badly...just really not good receipes.  Salad dressings were even bad...why whip all your dressings?  I think they try too hard.  Gorgeous looking inside.  The food just needs to follow suit.  They pour generous cocktails. If it wasn't for the decor this would be a 1 Star.

Vs-HXT-7V3QCwe6y133GAA.text: Can't believe it took me this long to write a review. I'm not sure how many times I've been to Pomelo, but everything is great. The chilaquiles, the drinks, the servers, management, etc. Great outdoor area too, especially when the weather's nice. So glad they're in the neighborhood.

AfdquauPWJiS3F7AkJTy7w.text: I was disappointed in this place   Firsts off the Service was excellent very polite and professional bar tenders and very attentive the food came out fast and hot.  Although everything ordered lacked in taste. The bbq wings were so over cooked that the meat was crunchy and rubbery not tended and juicy like wings should be. we decided to share a pizza the veggie one with mushrooms added maybe we just ordered the wrong pizza. It lacked in flavor we were putting dried chilies salt and pepper all over it to get a good flavor.   This was the first time I've come here so maybe it was just a bad first run but I'll update my review after a second chance.

HHdP8CjayQ_jDL4EyYZPdg.text: We've been waiting to visit the Orchard with much anticipation.   My rule of thumb is to wait a month after opening so they can work the bugs out.  We saved our first visit for our father's day celebration.  We were a bit disappointed to say the least.  We had a reservation (great that they take reservations) yet we were offered the worst table in the dining room.  So we opted for the lounge area.  My daughter ordered the house burger and I had the spicy fettuccine.  My daughter's opinion of her burger was "it was ok, not the best I've had, but not the worst either."  As for the fettuccine, it was tasty, but starchy and cold/Luke warm.  The meals were delivered in a timely manner.     Overall,  I was not sure who Pomelo's is trying to be.  The menu is not very creative or perhaps too creative, far too eclectic, with a limited selection and a bit pricy for the items on the menu.   The grounds are very impressive and promise far  more than what is offered.  Lucci's looked far more interesting than Pomelo's....next time.  One last thing,  as I said,  we went on father's day, not one person offered a "Happy Father's Day" wish. Not the hostess, the waiter,  the server,  or the owner/manager.      Please Pomelo's,  pay attention to the details!

TmBFm2u_eh52Oj-A8fwzSg.text: This place is cute. Outdoor space is beautiful and ambiance is nice especially for this time of the year. The food was average I think they could work on the entree items. The spinach dip was really good, like right along with Hillstones dip. The service was awesome both our server and manager. I sent my entree back (it was just blah it needed work) and manager gave me gift card so I could try again and I will. I will go again to try something else because they hadn't been open that long and something weird happened in the kitchen where the EMS came so I think it was just an off day. I love Luci's and wanna see this place do well. Oh Yea the mimosas on special on Sunday that's always a plus.

U7J45aNd9Y9mvAF5H0ITHw.text: Tonight (4/8/17) was the first of what I'm sure will be many visits to Pomelo.   We arrived on time for our 6:30 reservation. Even though they were quite busy, we were seated almost immediately.   The ambiance is fresh (upscale but casual) and their courtyard is open and inviting. Our server was killer! She had a great personality and was on her A-game the entire time.   Dinner was excellent. My brother's "birthday burger" was MASSIVE, my dad said his scallops were the best he's ever had and my Pesto Garden Pizza (add chicken and bacon) was perfection.   The only negative experience (during an otherwise 5 star evening) was in the attached ice cream shop (Splurge). I had noticed the server being abrupt with the customers ahead of us, so I wasn't too surprised to be rushed out the door as well. Strange because there was only one person behind us, yet it felt as if the line was out the door and it was closing time (which it wasn't). I asked if there was a flavor she could recommend that was popular and her response was "Um...I dun-know." Then, my dad asked to sample the salted caramel. She kinda seemed put out and actually sighed when getting a spoon!! Yay. Anyhow, we all have bad days and maybe that was hers. Hoping that was just a one-off.   Overall, it was a GREAT evening for our entire family at Pomelo. Highly recommended.

S7qR-UNiKuVOdN4YunmXLA.text: Wow, this place is outstanding!  Ride by here daily on my way home from work (favorite Strava segment!), and it's always steadily busy. Perfect striking distance from our house, so we stopped in for lunch last Sunday.   Service was fantastic. Sat at the bar, and both bartenders were on top of it. Very friendly, patient and incredibly attentive. Never did a drink go dry, and we were even brought hot towels for clean up after annihilating some wings, without asking. You can tell when a restaurant puts an emphasis on training and service, and this crew was top notch. I'll have to see if they maintain that level of service when it's busier.  Food was really good, and came out pretty quick. Ordered a pizza, wings and a burger. Wings were absolutely perfect, best I've had in years. Tender, slightly crisp skin, and covered with just the right amount of quality sauce. No slick of red oil goo here. Pizza was very good. I'm very picky about pizza, but they do an exceptional job here. Crust was about the perfect thickness, not chewy at all, crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Really good sauce, great cheese and awesome pepperoni. Reasonably sized and reasonably priced. Home run. The burger was fine, but I wouldn't order it again. It was a bit past medium, lacked flavor, and had a lot of stuff going on topping-wise, making it hard to eat. Certainly not bad, but forgettable. Fries were really good, however.  I'm not a hipster, but I do ride pretty much everywhere. Great to see good bike parking under the water tower. Overall vibe of the place is very interesting; lots of high quality work went into the construction and design. The bathrooms were really cool; lots of 1920's era touches that reminded me of some of the very old buildings/restaurants/train stations in KC or LA.   We will definitely be back, and I'm excited for the other plans they have for The Orchard. Really a cool place, lucky it's so close.

U5VIdx2XVRVihfBs6mOe4g.text: No clue why the bad ratings from everyone else. We had a great lunch!  Place is beautiful inside. I love the oversized furniture and finishes. Service was amazing! Everyone had a smile on their face, waitress was great as well. Attentive and prompt.   Food was very good!  We'll def be back

orLCehoSf4FdW4Enoae4Vw.text: Lovely  birthday dinner here!  Great open room (inside due to summer heat) looking forward to cooler months in their patio. My group ordered a variety of dishes and they all were delicious! Wings = tender and loaded with sauce  Pizza = sausage from Schreiners, house cheese blend was awesome!! Spicy fettuccine = spicy as advertised with noodles perfectly cooked Burger = huge amount of fries and burger perfectly cooked  Dessert= strawberry shortcake. Large enough serving to share 5 ways   Wonderful attentive servers.  Put that all together and it results in a great evening out!!

JHC0CKuN_CwYVaip-8gApg.text: I really wanted to like this place. Based on the write up in The Phoenix New Times, we were really looking forward to eating and hanging out here.  The restaurant and grounds are beautiful. It's a new business, I think they may have opened to early, before working all the kinks out of their service. And please understand, I expected that to some degree but what I can't tolerate is negligent or rude service.   - The hostesses were rude and distracted and one was chomping on chewing gum while she was talking to us.  - there were several employees standing around the hostess stand in a frenzied state of confusion  - we were told it would be between 45 mins and 2 hours for a wait. Had a table not come avail while we were waiting on our friends, we would have left. The wait was about 45 mins which is acceptable  - while waiting we sat outside in the cocktail area to wait get drinks and apps. The server was very slow and rude. Based on this alone I would have left  - server inside was pleasant but after we sat and ordered we never saw him again. No one came by to check on us, to see how the food was or to refill drinks or for us to order cocktails.   Good idea on the concept and I hope you do well. Pizza was good, burger and fries were just okay. But average food and poor service make it hard to want to come back when there are so many good restaurants in Phoenix now.

EaqkPa73ya4SxjyXUu_wNQ.text: I really wanted to write a fantastic review on this place.  Maybe my expectations were too high.    We arrived on a Monday at 1.  The hostesses were great... it was down hill from here...  Our waitress was slow... never really around... we looked around and it really was not that busy.  Our appetizer came out with our food :(  Nothing like dropping 18 dollars on the chef's cheese/meat plater to rush eating it in order to avoid a cold pizza.  Several olives fell off the plater due to the waitress being bumped by a co-worker. Her comment was "oh it was just a few that fell" - We assumed she would bring us back more olives... this never happened. :(   Lets talk about the pizza... aside the crust... it was awful.  It was the most flavorless margarita pizza I ever had.  It tasted as if a can of tomato sauce was poured on the dough and cheese and tomato added... extremely acidic and tart.  We also had to wait patiently... and I mean wait...  to ask for plates for our appetizer and pizza.  One Yelper wrote about the avoided eye contact - the entire wait staff has this.  It was as if they were afraid to help each other out.  Zero team effort.  So simple request like, "may I have a plate for my food" will go unanswered until your assigned waitress makes her way to you. :(   I'm going out on a limb of fairness... but maybe some of the entrees are better.  Regardless we will not be back.

8Xdk8YOGWbF-IVIHfF5T0Q.text: I really like this place. My friend was having her Birthday happy hour here and they accommodated her quite nicely. We were able to have the outside patio, which happened to be a very nice evening for June in Phoenix. They had the misters going as well but for once, it was not really needed (although they felt quite lovely) Our lovely server, who's name escapes me, was on top of things all night. I was even able to order off the kids menu (which sometimes restaurants won't let you do) as I didn't want a huge meal nor did I want to have to take home leftovers. Two delicious sliders and fries later along with two glasses of wine, and I was one happy customer. There were two ladies in our party that both ordered the lovely ribeye steak and they both raved about it. I swear if I was hungrier I would have definitely ordered it as it looked AMAZING!   The only issue was parking. You had to be quick in order to snag a parking spot as they are few and far between. I got very lucky as someone was coming out as I was coming in, but had that not have happened, I am not sure if I would have stayed as there really was no parking spots available. All in all, I will definitely be back again in soon!

4vkdfEJb4u8T9-99ZTQNow.text: First, and most importantly, the food is fantastic. The location is one of my favorites in the valley. The orchard is lovely and sitting on the patio is my favorite.  I tried Pomelo's with a friend a few months ago and I've been back four times since then. The food rates five stars, and I don't often go there. Unfortunately, the service is really hit or miss. So, there's a star missing for that. I've had really great service once, okay service twice, and poor service twice.   The food though, we haven't had one disappointment. I've probably tasted at least half the menu. The tuna tartare is excellent, very unique and absolutely irresistible. The calamari with shrimp is some of the best I've found in the Phoenix area. The pizza (not something I typically rave about) is pretty amazing. I adore the mushroom pizza and order it almost every time just to have some to take home.  The cocktails are typically pretty good and fairly strong, though we've had a couple misses. Overall, Pomelo is a strong favorite and I love taking friends there.

UTkxM7PD-pMfTn6Qh_sD7Q.text: I love this place.  My go to is the pepperoni pizza. I also get a mango rum drink.  Ordered the New York cheesecake I found out that it's actually imported from Jr's in New York. it was amazing huge and yummy best I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Imported from New York, Jrs
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Romantic patio seating

GOlbwiV0WOEujY8x8YMMIg.text: 02/17/2018: My husband and I met another couple here for a double date and we were impressed!   Since we were early for our reservation, we sat at the bar for a couple of libations. Teri was wonderful and was more than happy to cater to our high maintenance requests. While the drinks were a little on the pricey side, the pours were more than adequate to make up for it.   We started with two appetizers: Blistered Brussel Sprouts and the Garlic Focaccia. I am not a fan of balsamic so the Brussel sprouts were not my favorite, but my husband and friends thoroughly enjoyed them. If you are going to order the Garlic Focaccia you must order it with mozzarella and the pomodoro sauce! While a little on the salty side, this bread was hot, melty and overall had a good flavor.  For our entrees, we ordered the House Pizza which I was afraid would be too spicy for me, but it wasn't at all. It was delicious and a pizza I could eat again and again! The guys ordered the French Dip and Pork Chops. Both were content with their choices.   The service was great! Everyone from Teri to our server to the owner. Everyone spoke with us and made us feel welcome. We will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Loaded Brussel Sprouts
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French dip

zIvSo7rvvpffnJPMEilg-Q.text: We came here intending to go to Lucy's not knowing they share a lawn but are different. Regardless we were pleasently surprised. While the line at Lucy's was incredibly long we sat right down at the bar at Palmelo. The bar tender who served us was very busy but remained incredibly attentive. Great Mimosa specials and the food is fabulous. The menu has a very eclectic offering from pizza to chiliquillis (which i had and highly reccomend as they are made with a very hearty brisket meat), eggs benedict, and cinnimon rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch!

QKeuPazADPv9H0NAD7zF_A.text: Fabulous spot! Well thought out Property with lots to offer. Relaxing, beautiful, great food, excellent service. Highly recommend to Event the fussiest diner.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love this place! Beautiful scenic location. Great food, amazing service. Highly recommend! Worth a drive, even if it&#39;s from San Diego!

6sXK0CPoxbj5jwuiAoWh_g.text: Very nice atmosphere with outdoor seating (although we sat inside on the very comfortable and soft couches).   We arrived on Sunday at around 11 and had only a very short wait. Our waiter, Alex, was super attentive. He took our drink order right away and was very patient while we chatted with out of town guests.  Once we ordered our food arrived quickly and the coffee was filled regularly (and it's very good coffee).  All our food was very tasty...  To start we had the spinach dip with tortilla chips. The dip was warm and creamy and the chips seemed freshly made.  The rest of our food...  1) French toast-large portion, fresh berries and the vanilla bean marscapone (?) is delicate and yummy.  2) The Yogi-a smaller portion of yogurt with berries and granola. The yogurt is delicious. I didn't try the blueberry muffin but it looks delicious.  3) Eggs Benedict- we ordered both the regular and the corned beef hash, both were fantastic.  4) Pepperoni pizza and mushroom pizza-pretty big pizzas, plenty for two people to share. Both had loads of toppings.  Again, the service was great and they were patient in allowing us to sit for quite awhile.  I would love to come again and sit outside, maybe for another brunch and have a bloody Mary (another person in our group ordered one so I was able to try it).  My only complaint was the persistent fly that continued to bother us but hey, if I were outside we'd have that same issue, right?  Overall a great place to sit, chat and have some great good with wonderful service.

W96rLfKeLlHurUnxB7whBQ.text: OMG!! Seriously delicious. First time and we'll definitely be back soon. I had the shrimp fettuccini and hubs had the Land and Sea both were amazing. This is some of the best pasta I've had. We also had the spin dip and creme brulee, once again, delicious. The atmosphere was very sexy, perfect for a date night or evening out with friends. The music was awesome and the service was top notch (the manager took our pic!). If you're in the area or looking for something new, give them a try! This is truly a must have if you're a foodie!

7ABFCKYShUUeWfC1qMjtng.text: Food was delicious, drinks were strong, and the service was great. I will definitely go back. It's adorable and the patio is awesome. It was too hot to sit on the patio but I would like to sit out there in the cooler weather.

u5X8ufAHuQOf5_0QFm7VGQ.text: Great service, tasty pizza and terrific atmosphere!  What a pleasure to go to a restaurant and be able to have a conversation and actually hear the other person and not have to raise your voice!  We will be back!!  Many of the new restaurants along 7th Street have shut down - they were all way too loud.  Background music is just that -- for the backround.  Pomelo!!

BOJ2oWwCq5PBLjSHUiUonA.text: Just popped in randomly on a Monday and was thrilled with the service, food, and the $25 pizza and bottle (of wine) special. Added the Salmon appetizer and it too, was perfect. Making this a regular stop!

AsVQCKYXGXTcQyFfB1mOXw.text: The restaurant and patio are beautiful. I had a gluten free margherita pizza, which was a tiny bit soggy and perhaps not as flavorful as it could have been. The service was not great-I had to wait ten minutes for someone to take my order and I had to ask for my iced tea to be refilled.  The waitress was pleasant, just inattentive and not trying to anticipate my needs.

RCT2MQeJQjgquGFmFMLXFA.text: I've been here twice now and pretty impressed, more so on the second visit.  First visit I had the prime rib which was pretty good but I have had better.  The portion size was pretty huge.  This time I had the carnivore pizza which was part of the $20 special which was a pizza and a bottle of wine, very good deal.  The pizza had this Tasso ham which is a must try!  It also had sausage and pepperoni.  Crust was very good, made with caputo flour which is supposed to be the best for pizza.  Also had the side salad with homemade Green Goddess dressing which was amazing.  It's made with yoghurt and basil.   Our server was very knowledgeable about the food, recommended the Green Goddess and also had an interesting conversation about cheese.     This place is attached to Luci's and it is a destination in itself.  After dinner you can walk the grounds and if you feel like ice cream go over to Luci's ice cream and candy shop.  It is very peaceful to sit outside on one of the benches enjoying ice cream.    This is a place you will want to come back to over and over.  Bring your friends!

hhUWdnXKkQ6TN4oVX1DlZg.text: First and foremost, I am very proud of this place - it's a beautiful place ! Indoor or outdoor, you feel like a million-bucks dining spot...and it's in my neighborhood.  Second: The simplicity of food (earthy tone) and healthiness...had me sold.  Third: Staff are incredible friendly and a working as a team - helps with the dining experience (tremendously). Fourth: It's affordable with menu-prices...for the incredible tasty and healthy food.  Fifth: Oh...the HAPPY HOUR is should be the number ONE on my list.  Kudos and Happy (HOUR) Dining !

2Prljl5ebxUWaxYOdwEoUQ.text: Was a huge fan and 5 star review of this place until a negative experience on Mother's Day.  The restaurant tried to make things right, so changed my review, but still a bit soured by the entire experience.  In short, I do believe that management is trying to offer customer's a positive experience.

N4WyoGYHr3yxRixDBtEtvA.text: Four of us ate at this restaurant last night on the patio.  The setting could not have been more lovely, although... there was an event under the tented area in the middle with a man with a microphone!  We believe the gathering was political in nature, but whatever it was, regardless, it was obnoxious!  We felt we competed with the speaker, which seemed to have gone on for hours.  Not good.  Although overall the food was good, the service was not great as they were under staffed.

gg8ZtM3jhyY82qSy_2ogcA.text: I've been here a few times and each visit has been fantastic. The setting is absolutely delightful. I love the fire pit and the lights in the trees. The whole vibe is relaxed and fun. There is also plenty of parking!  But enough about all that- THE FOOD. We had the grilled wings, hummus, salmon, braised short ribs, and the pesto garden pizza- every bite was delicious and all of our special requests were perfectly executed. We really enjoyed the staff as well. They were very attentive. I think our servers name was Julie, and she was lovely. The manager, Frankie, was charming and made sure we felt welcomed. We love coming to Pomelo.

T6-sRTPtioo3u2l_iq9C_Q.text: The Orchard area is very beautiful at night and it being Prom weekend and seeing all the couple's dressed up eating made it seem even more special! The appetizers were great the fried calamari and the spinach dip were both extremely tasteeeeee!  The cocktails were solid as well.  The main course...now that was a showstopper the wood fired pizza was decadent and as a pizza connoisseur this was one of the better pizzas Ive had. I chose the carnivore and loved it however the meat on top was a bit hard to bite through...guess having too much meat is a good problem to have. My buddy had the pepperoni pizza and with the ricotta on top was literally life changing. I will be back for some more very soon. Who knows maybe I'll pretend to be going to a prom as well just to make the night feel as lovely as this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xrTZge_TrDBTRv9Uj9Z5dw.text: Saturday morning brunch. This place is awesome. Nice patio area if you want to enjoy the outdoor scenery. Great service. The young waiter was in the process of training a new staff, but didn't miss a beat. The food was great with healthy options. Really liked the dessert and red sangria. Would definitely return for a visit

akqBNBh-iIDKfCFzgAxUeQ.text: Oddly located on a citrus farm in the middle of a community, Pomelo is one of the many ever-so-popular "concept" restaurants that keep popping up, with this particular location being one-third of a group of joints owned by Luci's Urban Concepts. Despite opening in mid-2016, Pomelo somehow flew under my radar until recently.  The grounds as a whole has sort of a cute, but manufactured feel to it. Pomelo itself, as many people have already stated, exhibits sleek decor within a somewhat sterile environment.  They offer both tables and booths. My girlfriend and I were seated at a corner booth, or as I refer to it, a "mob booth," as it allows me to visually scan the entire restaurant to prepare for any oncoming attackers.  For starters, we ordered the garlic focaccia with melted mozzarella and a side of pomodoro sauce. Honestly, neither one of us were really impressed. The cheese had zero presence, almost as if it wasn't even there, despite clearly being able to see it. It was essentially nothing more than soggy bread, with the bland sauce doing very little to aid its appeal. On the plus, it was definitely a generously sized portion.  Additionally, we ordered their elote, or as us white folk call it, grilled corn on the cob. Aided by some not-so-spicy aioli and feta, we both really enjoyed its flavor to the point where it was clearly the stand-out dish of the evening. Although hitting your climax during foreplay is never a good sign, right?  We ordered a standard pepperoni pizza and after a brief debate about trying a burger, settled on the spicy fettuccine. I'll give them some credit for the fettuccine being something different, as the addition of chorizo makes it a little more interesting. Although in the end, it didn't really stand out as anything I'd order again.  As for the pizza? I'm overly-critical, but try to always approach all new places with an open-mind. But honestly, it just didn't do it for us. The toppings were okay, but nothing, whether it be the cheese, sauce, or pepperoni, really had any pop whatsoever. The crunchy crust had the charred look, but its flavor reminded me of eating something that has been harshly baked. I can't quite describe it - but it draws comparisons to the pizzas I'd get at Humble Pie or one of those corporate chains - which isn't really a compliment.   For desserts, they offered two options with lava cake or a salted caramel shortbread. Since we've yet to find lava cake that we've liked, we opted for the shortbread. Unfortunately, the caramel overpowered the whole thing, so instead of eating a cookie that's complimented by caramel, you're eating a goopy load of ultra-thick caramel that is complimented by cookie crumbs. Neither one of us finished it, which rarely happens with desserts.  Honestly, I don't want to be too harsh on this place. I mean, nothing was particularly wrong with the food. I believe everything was served the way its intended to be. It just simply wasn't for us.  The server was pleasant, although things seemed somewhat slow. With starters, entrees, and a dessert, we were there for over two hours. Overall, the place does have some potential and will most likely garner a set of regular diners over time.  Although we didn't really like it, since it's a new business, I still think people should try it for themselves and draw their own conclusions.
