P8EUudCnJ8sL_VLYdW_HrQ.text: The mushroom pizza was amazing!! It exceeded all my expectations. I also got the smoked salmon appetizer. The presentation was beautiful! The creme brulee dessert was very good! I liked how the glazed sugar wasn't too hard. The ambiance is very nice. Would definitely come back again! Excellent food and service.

yUKa-S-dDHka_v8LNdq-Ew.text: Great service,  Ideal layout and location, a hidden gem.  Roasted sprouts were good but a little hard.  The salmon appetizer was well presented.  We ordered the Kids French Toast, Rustic Omelette, Fish Sandwich, Salmon Salad, and Benedict.  Good presentations on all. The house breakfast potato needed seasoning and the Benedict more hollandaise.   Server was excellent.  Will come again.  JFM

s7CTOG7fem9gOi6aEt93RQ.text: We frequent this restaurant, especially for the pizza & wine special on Mon. & Tues. I sat at the bar on Wed. w/ a friend for dinner & asked what veggies were being served w/ the salmon. Ordered & didn't get one vegetable the bartender mentioned. Plus, they added meat (chorizo) to the veggies. Huh? Who does that??? Told the bartender it wasn't what I ordered and rather that comping the meal they chose to offer a resolution $3 less than the total meal so they could make a $3 profit. Now, I agreed to this because I did eat 1/2 of the salmon, but, really? Why not just comp the meal? It left a bad taste in my mouth, literally. Plus, the bartender serving us didn't return after my complaint & sent someone else out to finish billing us. In an area with so many restaurants, I don't see how offering such poor service will keep them alive. There was no one in the dining room at 7:30 pm on a Wed. either. Hmmmm.

nqiFU38QpcFbVmhc_Klg-w.text: Everything was great... Service was good, food was good... We sat at the bar and then ordered chicken fingers for our daughter at home to go... The waitress with the short blonde hair stopped the bartender before she rang it in and said "they have to be 12 or younger to order that." She had no idea or any business butting into our order at all. We were ordering for our daughter. Maybe keep comments away from the customers and mind her own business??

GPm1rwsbC_AaGMtrJbHNKw.text: I wanted to like this place so badly! It was adorable but that's where it ended. It took a while to get our drinks and the waitress came to take our food order before the drinks even came out. It took an hour to get our food and then the food order was wrong. They said the reason the food took so long was because they had an issue thawing out the fish. Lovely! Then they brought out a pizza instead of the ribs (pizza was good) but the wrong order. Then it took about 20 minutes for them to split the bill down the middle on 2 cards. They blamed everything on glitches so maybe I'd try again in a few months when the glitches are worked out but you only have 1 chance to make a first impression. So disappointing:-(

yui9lVkyyPmSWkrgCgQXmw.text: It's super chic and cozy. I love the outdoor space and lots of parking. It's close to home but so is Postino's and they have a great happy hour. None here. Not much for choices on the menu and for the type of food, kinda pricey. I had the mussels and the sauce was great but the mussels tasted like sewage, definitely old. My husband had their pepperoni pizza which we both loved. Then we ordered their fig and pear cobbler which was amazing. We sat inside and still flies were everywhere around our food so it felt like sitting outside trying to shoo all the flies away while eating. We will have to come back when they have worked out all of their issues. Staff was very friendly but General Manager should learn how to manage and be part of his staff team.

Xx72PIbL_4-YxzVbiqsJ2w.text: I've had some pretty bad service before, but this place tops them all hands down. I stopped in earlier this week and at first sight, the place looks great. The hostess greeted me right away but on her way to seat me got distracted by another staff member and I was just expected to wait for them to finish their conversation. The server came out right away but was very clearly uncomfortable. The service was so robotic the whole way through. I ordered a salad and the mussels. That was a mistake- when the food finally came out, the taste was rancid. Clearly not fresh. I finished my salad, asked for the check and left. The server didn't even ask about the full plate of mussels. I'll spend my money elsewhere moving forward. Not a good first impression.

jYDabWq-qGSqG3Cka71UEQ.text: My husband and I had dinner there on a Sunday evening to celebrate my birthday. The restaurant was not crowded so we had no difficulty with parking or table selection.  The weather was pleasant and we enjoyed the patio setting. The service was great - attentive but not intrusive.  The food was excellent! We had garlic focaccia as an appetizer, a great choice. My husband had the ribeye and I had spicy fettucine.  We were both very happy with our meals. We stopped into the onsite ice cream shoppe for gelato dessert.  It could not have been better! We can't wait to go back.

iYQrjxVBpj2CbbRX3LAAYw.text: The hostess and servers were very kind. Things seemed a little slow to come out and they didn't seem overly busy or understaffed. For example our salads and then meal came before our appetizer, even though between salad and the meal  we asked the waitress if it was still coming, so we ended up cancelling the appetizer. Ordered beet salad (excellent) and pesto garden pizza (more kale than other veggies, not a lot of flavor, good crust- but I'll stick to my Papa Murphy's veggie pizza!) and my husband had steak and mashed potatoes.  With as many excellent restaurant choices there are in the Valley, I don't think I'll need to repeat this one

Br5g2TWhUFnzRFdoLYQfYQ.text: I love this new neighborhood restaurant.   We had amazing tender fall off the bone baby back ribs with polenta cakes and a lite fresh coleslaw.  The grass fed cheeseburger was delicious.   My boys loved the pizzas.  The atmosphere that has been created is amazing in this old orchard in the middle of north central Phoenix.

rUK0rk2i23jwAIBotgd8NQ.text: Love it. Locals Gem! Beautiful restaurant- perfect for various occasions. Had dinner at the bar with excellent service on date night. Also was a great spot to bring clients/large party on separate occasion. Great food and ambiance. Perfect patio for a bottle of wine; Great mixology and wine list!!!

0yZEohZGGOCsYY5Q8pm-ww.text: Not worth my time. Limited parking, reservation at 7pm and left the restaurant at 7:45 because we were still waiting. Hostess was rude and non-apologetic. Bartenders were out products and failed to mention any specials.

mS2F5a2NpzBT2VpuptxhKA.text: If you want to leave feeling stressed, embarrassed, and upset then Pomelo is the place for you! DO NOT COME HERE with a large group or at all. Made a reservation for a group of 12, many who had never been to Pomelo.   Horrible service, not accommodating, lipstick marks on glasses, inexperienced employees, burnt food....the list goes on and on. So unfortunate because I love supporting local businesses:(

5ls-UpMnpk36qu9yxOvUGQ.text: Despite some negative reviews concerning service, we  checked this place out and were totally pleased. On the contrary, service was very conscientious and prompt. We sat on the patio and it is very charming. We were there for happy hour, but ended up ordering pizza. The happy hour app list is a bit limited, but what they have looks ok, and priced reasonably at $5. Beers were one dollar off. The pizzas were quite good. We tried the mushroom and the vegetarian. My only complaint is that the tap list is very limited. They only have 4 taps. On the plus side, one of them was Grapefruit Sculpin, which suited us just fine. If you have not yet been there, check this place out. I don't think you will be disappointed.

hQPWHwwlm83Db1st9eBK9g.text: Like other reviewers here, my friends and I were anticipating a great lunch in a lovely setting.  The setting was lovely and the new building was nicely decorated, but the first thing we noticed when we sat down was the noise.  We couldn't hear ourselves and definitely couldn't have a conversation. We liked our food, but the service was terrible.  One meal was  brought out long before the rest of us were served.  We couldn't get our checks and then no one came to take our money.  Since I didn't need change, I finally left mine on the table and left.  I don't know what they can do about the noise, but they must improve the service if they want to make this place a success.

51V2RKbTIDg_YNuO-QS7Ug.text: I really wanted to love this place and maybe one day I will but not now. They were clearly understaffed or just simply overwhelmed and it was 7pm on a Tuesday. The food was ok but we ordered wings as an app and they came out after our meal. I stated to the bartender that at that point we could do without. Sure enough they came out anyway and were placed in front of us at the bar. We went ahead and tried them because they were there. I think they should have been taken off of the bill. I will try one more time.

x_90dm0s6xs7-kO_L8sCOA.text: A Great find...this is a beautiful restaurant in an amazing setting. Set in a former citrus grove this restaurant in tastefully done, both for inside and outside dining. The menu is well designed, featuring entree salads, pizzas, and a great burger. The burger was cooked to perfection, med.-rare, with lettuce, tomato and cheese. Plus, their fries are delicious, perfectly prepared, crisp and favorable. Their salads are also beautifully prepared, the Caesar with salmon was perfection. The salmon was moist and flavorful, perfectly cooked. They offer a full bar with an extensive wine list, both by the bottle or the glass. The service was first rate, attentive, but, not overwhelming. Also, in the complex is a ice cream and candy shop, along with Luci's a sandwich, deli, and general-type store. I would highly recommend Pomelo, an excellent restaurant experience.

xd26QxVxTNifqm-OiYlrlw.text: Just went for the first time last night for cocktails with friends.  The space is a repurposed old farmhouse and the location was a nursery for many years.   They did an amazing job and I loved the atmosphere.   Had a couple of pizzas which were quite good and had all of the right ingredients (good crust, schreiners sausage et cetera).   Cocktail list is small but looked interesting.  We just had wine but I want to go back to try out other things.  Can't wait to explore more....

OvNgqcYTjqlhupWQlEarQA.text: Fish soup- to salty Ribs- slightly burnt taste was par and tough not worth $22 Burger- grass feed beef great but no flavor  Spinach dip- large pieces but tough had better but was okay Kids tenders- sent back burnt and dry, next batch was great.

inaGdLsmd2YzKpSLJILfNA.text: Had a great experience there today.  Everyone was friendly and on point. My friend had the burger and I had the brisket sandwich(lunch special), and both were very tasty. We both agreed we will be back for sure!

-WpeaqlnfJoKSdrjviVbrg.text: I updated my prior review from last year with the bad experience that we had on Father's day.  Jerry, one of the owners reached out to me to see if he could remedy the situation.  It was nice to see that he cared because I've lived in this neighborhood since the late 80's and I love it and want the bars & restaurants around me to succeed.  We had a great conversation and he offered me a gift card to return.  Last night we met up with another couple from the Italian Club for happy hour and all of us had a great time.  The food (bbq ribs, brussels sprouts and calamari) were spot on and we enjoyed our cocktails as well.  Mike the bartender was really great and took good care of us.  Ken, 1 of the owners stopped by our table to check in to see how we were doing.  He even brought of samples of the Pomelo vodka that's made right here in AZ.  So in conclusion we'll be back and hopefully we'll have more of our Italian Club friends join us.

jHl24xSLFhquAX6AOcay7g.text: Fantastic food, amazing ambiance, and personable service. The only not-so-great thing was the wait, but we weren't in a hurry. We enjoyed a nice glass of wine and a cocktail. We will visit this place again. :-)

bj5FhMkQTx_JXxmXema1Zg.text: AMAZING!!!!! Went here on a whim; however, we have been wanting to go here for awhile and just forgot. We will never forget about this place again. Pizza is outstanding! Ken, the owner, explained to us that they worked on the dough for over 3 years. Cocktails are awesome and our bartender, Jess, was the best ever. I would come back just for her. All around fabulous experience and a new go-to.

XtpVXo69HYOvE5VGyIqO9Q.text: Super disappointed. Frequent the original Lucis and had high expectations for this place. Pomelo was pretty empty at brunch and yet the service was horribly slow, ice tea took forever to get. Then there was a large hair in the glass that took another 10 minutes to get a new one, poached eggs on the Benedict were over cooked and hard, there was wayyyyyy too much salt in the gravy for the biscuits and gravy. Just wasn't anything that will make us want to go back.

bOWVLCy7pfKSOhqbtw0c3Q.text: We've been here before & enjoyed it , but not pleased today!!! Steak overcooked & wait staff informed. We don't begrudge anyone , & is still relatively new,  but $ 106.00 before tip is ridiculous for overcooked food. My husband & I switched entrees due to my steak being over cooked. No attempt by staff to rectify. Will not be returning.

nE8XUYExfksS-X9WI_Wr-Q.text: Tomorrow's lunch will be my 5th or 6th meal at Pomelo - I've enjoyed their brunch, lunch & dinner and the food is outstanding!  My 2 current food favorites are the beet salad (with chicken) & the ribs.  The ambience is relaxing & the wait staff is attentive as well as being friendly & informative.  I love turning people on to this restaurant.  Clean, locally sourced food is cooked to perfection & is complemented by a a full bar.

gl_-zGp8Tb8LK0TOI56KwQ.text: Such a fantastic date night spot! The firepit outside was so wonderful to have drinks by. Would recommend to anyone who will listen!

nFHpxQ0ztroEM1eEM_Xd4w.text: This place is so so cute, and I almost wish we could have saved our first time here for brunch, but alas.  We ordered the $23 meat and cheese board and it was pepperoni thrown in a plate, like 4 rolled up salami slices, a couple of toasted bread slices, some gross smoked Gouda, literally 3 pickle slices, and 3 slices of an orange.  I could have bought all of those ingredients in whole for about $11.  And why orange slices???  I have never had a charcuterie board with citrus.  It was so awful and overpriced...oh I wish I would have taken a picture of the sad spread.  The pepperoni pizza was soggy and the cheese tasted off.  The spicy linguine was pretty good, and the prime rib was delish(it was a special of the night).  Overall not worth the price tag, but cute place to sit outside and have a cocktail.

u2HScf3L8uuXHsocA-bn0A.text: We went again for brunch- still terrible service and the food was so-so. I got posole but instead of soup it was dry ingredients with a small amount of broth. Not flavorful at all. My family got the chiliqueles and did like that. My hubby got a burger and the bottom bun was so soggy he had to eat the burger with a fork. We ordered a pizza to go and once again, it sat on the counter in the kitchen for over 15 minutes before it was boxed and brought to us. We watched it as it sat and watched them box the cold pizza. We asked several times if that was ours as we saw it sit and get cold and they said no each time but when ours came out it was cold. Service is still serious lacking! It is weird but everyone in there seems high. We have thought that both times and other people have commented on it as well. Won't be returning again.

TjzV1jurFtwzqWDStIUACQ.text: Very nice setting. Mediocre food and service. Could be a much better experience. Disappointing.

iz1yFpEZRtcxkSzZQNbVmA.text: Absolutely incredible experience! The food was excellent and the service was perfect. My wife and I wanted to try something new for our date night. So I made a reservation at Pomelo after doing some research online. I have to say they made me look like a superhero. The ambience, the food, and the service more than exceeded our expectations. My wife even commented that it was the best meal she ever had! We will definitely be returning to Pomelo and bringing our friends and family with us.

ohuByNXLeDvl_D7nxKDg4A.text: We loved this place!  Friendly staff, delicious food and great atmosphere!  Enjoyed sitting around the fire pit after dinner.

iZu0KTkFQcCwk_R9jPRYig.text: So yesterday my family and I went to check out this restaurant and I was actually very excited as all of our friends have talked so much about how delicious food is and how super friendly and welcoming everyone is , so my expectations where very high to be honest. And when we arrived there everything was just so clean and pretty and the staff where just amazing and so sweet ! We order the Napolitan Pizza and I have to say it's by far the best pizza I had tested, our order didn't take long we waited for not long at all ,  the kids loved it we all enjoyed the entire day . We had so many spills with my kids and the staff where more than happy to help us out. If can give them more stars i would ! I recommend this place 100%

qG-Q-dwaWRK7rCcziMcasg.text: Ok so I had to make a yelp account just for this matter. My boyfriend and I go out on dates normally ounce a week so, I decided to try Pomelo for the first time. The menu has many things to choose from but I couldn't really understand what type of region the food was since I saw everything from pizzas to My new favorite salmon dish. That's probably the only thing that I can say negative or it could be positive for others because I normally know if I'm going to an Italian restaurant or Mexican cuisine, here they had a blend of everything. My boyfriend tried the pork chop that was cooked perfectly and I had the wild salmon which had this arugula salad topped of on that was very citrusy. The server we had was very attentive and was always checking on us. The place is gorgeous and We will for certainly be coming back again. Thanks for the great experience guys!!

KQUrVMRzVxzekbY5B4Cy9g.text: I have been to pomelo several times over the past few months.  It has become my families and my favorite restaurant.  We love everything on the menu, and the kids particularly love the pizza. We have gotten to know some of the staff, and never had an issue with the service. The location and the grounds are really stunning and welcoming.    I love bringing my friends here to experience the atmosphere.  It is really beautiful at night, and highly recommend you give it a try.

yq81rMCILy_MWj_0ucyqWw.text: For my brother's birthday the whole family went to Pomelo's. We ordered the spinach artichoke dip and the garlic foccaccia. Both were very flavorful. The spinach artichoke dip also come with an amazing, spicy salsa. The foccaccia comes with a full clove of roasted garlic. My brother and I both got the pepperoni pizza, and it was phenomenal. The Shrieners pepperoni was delicious, and the blend of the ricotta and fresh basil was a perfect compliment. My wife got the burger, which was perfectly seasoned. It has a smokey sweetness to it and the fries were well seasoned as well. Also the bar mixes a nice strong drink. I had a double gin and tonic, my brother had a Belvidere martini, dirty, and my wife has the Belissimo, one of their signature drinks, also very tasty.

zJidOfQGR6xadY0PIKpYZw.text: Love the atmosphere and the pizza. Happy hour is also great. Have seen people unhappy with the food and the staff go above and beyond to try and make them happy. Not sure what some of the other reviews are talking about when they mention poor service. We have always been treated excellent.

_6kLsDKI_IUUJ23iVDX94Q.text: Like several other reviewers, I really wanted to like Pomelo.  The property is wonderful. But the service is so bad.  So, so bad.    so  bad.

nh7ln-rPkmhJciEnr4yNnw.text: Great lunch with amazing service with Bridget! Couldn't decide on starters so we had: calamari & shrimp, wings & spinach dip! Pizza was excellent as well as the beet salad. Nice neighborhood feeling!  Friendly, open & inviting...the Orchard is a neighborhood gem!

zV2Qy2qOFHEGKyJkrPwDGw.text: So happy this restaurant opened in my neighborhood. Had dinner here for the first time, and will definitely be back. The service we had was excellent--both by our actual server and a couple others who stopped by to refill drinks and clear plates. Clearly, teamwork is important here and that's what makes the service so good. I was also really impressed by the food--the spinach dip might be the best I've ever had. We also ordered the mushroom pizza and spicy fettuccine which were both flavorful and delicious. The grounds are beautiful, and I like the intimate size of the dining room. Excited to try some of the other menu items in the future, and sit on the patio when the weather is cooler!

0USwo8H-7Ot1DuezTG7zmg.text: Yeeeah....I really wanted to like this place, I really did and the place was packed when we got there. Food is NOT worth the price. Dry chicken, soggy pizza and undercooked  rice that almost made me break a tooth. The hostess was super friendly though and made us laugh, and the wait staff all seemed pretty happy. You could tell the difference between the wait staff/management/owner, which kind of says alot. The wait staff was chipper, smiling and eager to please. Management was up their ass, stressed out and running around. And the owners were...nowhere to be seen?....kinda strange. Except there was a lady, in a gray dress, that looked like she was miserable  walking around. So, all in all the place is new and has some shit to fix. I hope when I come back  in a few months the food will have gotten better and the lady in the gray dress will have gotten the stick out of her butt.

yfCATxWR6t3L2q2bfyxbhQ.text: Concept is outstanding. Scenery is lovely. Staff is awesome. Food is just straight up bland. We've tried a number of items on several different occasions thinking it would get better the 'next' time. I've been disappointed each and every time. From the bbq ribs, wings, pork chop, pizza, mashed potatoes, roasted vegetables, coleslaw...just absolutely no flavor. The sad part is having to pay for tasteless food every time. I really wanted to like this place, and will definitely be back to Luci's, but I have to give my honest opinion and this is it.

Vp2TzCjwZXKnqEkEDrp1Yw.text: My #1 complaint is there is no where you can find the nutritional value? Calories, calories from fat , protein etc. In todays age of vegan, gluten & keto this is very important!! It is not that had for a business to add up the information & have it for their customers.  Now for the food: Hummus platter was amazing. The hummus was not over salted etc. Spinach & artichoke was yummy too! Beet salad? Where is the beet? Lol .... don't waist your money I had the Pork chop mine was cooked to perfection nice & moist. Vegetables were fine nothing special. Garlic mashed potatoes felt over milked , like it cane from a box not a real potato? I like thicker mashed potatoes with chucks of roasted garlic.  Server was very friendly & ambience beautiful .

1kXx-t-W7JRJ1W438ZhpQA.text: I absolutely adore the shopping center where Pomelo is located, very neat and family oriented. The food is pretty good too at this establishment the only issues I have like some others have stated is that depending on the time you go they can have a pre fix menu that does not include some if there popular items, which can be unfortunate if you are looking to order one of you goto entrees. Generally this is around brunch time. Also service can be a bit spotty as well, but overall it is a quality restaurant.

Lw26lv5ONszZftubWRIz8w.text: We had a rough start upon our arrival, the reservation got mixed up, but Michael got it all straightened out for us, and even offered us free drinks for the trouble. That is the way to manage a restaurant! Our waitress, Julia, was also very sweet. Service was a little slow, but the place was filled with two large parties. We were there on a Wednesday night and I had the Fish Tacos and Margarita for $15, both excellent. The atmosphere is so pleasant, especially if the weather cooperates.  We love the Orchard, including Luci's, so we are big fans of both eating places. It's really a hidden gem.

Wz9e7xefMI2S11Y3Hqo_Kw.text: Pomelo is an adorable spot if you can find it. It is part of the larger Luci's at the Orchard and it nestled in a neighborhood so you can easily miss it if you do not know where you are going.   The service was outstanding, our server gave good descriptions of the menu and made a few suggestions. I had the cinnamon bum (yum) and the french dip (it was good but I've had much better). The green tea was awesome and I drank three glasses no thanks to my bladder.  They easily gave individual tabs which was nice as we had a big group.

4vp9XU_Zrtc4Z9wV74sSlw.text: Linda! Last night was the best party of my life! Thank you for the most unforgettable night- you were a dream to work with and I'm grateful for you and your staff. What a night!!!!  Ps the FOOD and AMBIANCE were also AH-MAZ-ING!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SPRrXBAZw5ev2hRjeOCczw.text: This place is the worst. The owner is a complete jerk and treats the customer like they owe him. Completely arrogant. Take some classes in customer service.  Edit: So after this post I immediately get an angry reply from Sarah S. accusing me of posting this because of someone called Alex and threatens to report me for collusion with Alex. First of all, I don't know Alex and secondly this exemplifies the type of service this place has. I can't tell if a manager claims he's the owner. All I know is someone says he's the owner and then proceeds to act like a jerk. I post this so they can see the type of place they run and maybe take the time to investigate and improve. Instead they get defensive and then threatening. I'll admit I probably didn't meet the owner tonight(I just don't know)  but if this is the type of establishment he or she is running, I can't imagine it would be any different if I did meet him/her. Get your staff under control.

ilOot9TL_BUe1Elaa6gHtA.text: We were greeted by our server and bartender Scott and sat promptly. He got us waters and our draft orange blossom beers quickly and was back to take our order shortly, despite being the only server during a lunch rush. Our food was delicious and well prepared. The dressing on the coleslaw was tasty but not too heavy. He checked back on us and got my hubby his ketchup quick. Our water was refilled and the bill and box were brought in a timely manner. Great place, very cool vibe.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken pesto wrap with coleslaw and the Grass Fed Burger w/side salad

HmNGQAJfWhgDnWoOHa4SeA.text: I can't say enough good things about my experience with Pomelo. I was looking for a venue for my sisters bridal shower and wasn't finding anything I loved for a reasonable price. I came across Lucis and from my first interaction with Linda I knew I had found the perfect place. She was so helpful and accommodating. We were able to use the outdoor tented area for our event and it was absolutely beautiful. The menu and food options I had to choose from were excellent and they taste and presentation of them was the same. We had a 3 hour event their with our own bartender who also made sure everything was perfect before, during and after. I can't wait to have another reason to have an event here!

QaagGFlyfZyyAvIl40wfpA.text: Delicious breakfast.  We tried the veggie omelette and the French toast. They were both very good and I would recommend either.  The potatoes were an exceptional part of both.  Wonderful relaxing atmosphere, good coffee, decent mimosas, and friendly staff.  If I had to say something negative, it would be they have a limited number of breakfast items to choose from.  Again however, what we did try was very good

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

j8mj20aveH5Y17BQNAR7Hg.text: What a neat spot! Nestled in a very suburban neighborhood, it sneaks up on you as it's tucked back from the street. Love the outdoor area of the restaurant with the grassy area- lots of kiddos were running around enjoying themselves. The awnings hanging are the perfect touch. The restaurant itself features a patio area with umbrellas covering shade. In quintessential PHX fashion it was too hot to sit outside today so we headed in. Although late for our resi the server was very accommodating and seated us in a room off the bar in a "living room" styled area with a large fireplace and hanging candelabra. The dark green walls and leather booths give it a homey effect- it works.   I really liked the menu & although I'm on a super annoying cleanse & was unable to try Everything, they were really accommodating to my dietary needs and gave me my order exactly as requested.   Our server was attentive & stopped in enough for beverage refills. It was a business meeting so her attentiveness was not excessive or insufficient- Goldilocks rule applies: just right.   Our booth was a bit on the small size. I'd say it was doable for two women, one petite but would be cramped to be both carving at a steak next to one another. They're more of a 2 party booth set up.   My salad was fantastic and as stated, made to my request. The chopped salad looked delicious as did the garlic focaccia bread, which is a massive serving I might add. Great spot that I hope to return too! And also a small but very well appointed bar within.

kQYRH2sg3DBvpoQKDHP3sQ.text: We sat at an outdoor table near the fire pit during the winter. It was cold, but the fire pit helped. They were able to get the heat lamp working for about half the time we dined there. Everything we ordered including pizzas, brussel sprouts, burger, wings, etc. were good. My friend had a food allergy and let the server know. Sure enough, the kitchen and server did not pay attention and did not omit the item. So she and everything had to wait for her food. It would have been nice if they had offered a complimentary app or drink while she waited.  Without the firepit, it would have been too cold on a winter night.  The inside of the restaurant looked cute. Interestingly, it only seemed like older couples were sitting inside. Afterwards, we got some pastries from Luci's across the fake grass area for dessert.

cseffP-nZw1IQjwhxSsVSA.text: Went here for a group function. We sat outside under a tarp. There were a couple of propane heaters to keep guests warm. We had a dedicated open bar. The wines were disappointing and the liquor second rate. However, the staff were nice and gave generous pours. We started out with some yummy apps, which included some sinful artichoke dip. Entrees were three pastas, each of which was very good. Desserts were petite but tasty bites. A nice night, but I'd like to order from the menu to get a better feel for this place.

ByehqYyq3MfKFfUQcphJZw.text: One of our fav neighborhood spots! The happy hour is great, the food is awesome, and the patio and courtyard situation is the best in the neighborhood.   I've hosted a bridal shower and lots of other client events with this group and they are amazing to work with. Love, love, love our friends at Pomelo/The Orchard/Luci's!

AK0-j0T1VfgQBR7BNleH_Q.text: If you're looking for an overpriced meal where you can leave unsatisfied, look no further.   $15 Cod sandwhich had a huge slab of cod but overall it was very bland. The "cole slaw" was just shredded lettuce with more bland cream sauce. Oh and I was actually charged $16 so the menus are out of date too.  Wife had the $15 beet salad which was mostly just salad and a few beets. Meh.  Only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the landscaping/patio space is gorgeous and the fries were top notch.

7NcHHVROd6mVfTEdNtWedg.text: Me and my family came in here for the first time, and as soon as you come in you can feel how cozy this place is, and the warmth of the staff's attention. After trying a few samples of local bourbons and vodkas, the food arrived. Deliciously fresh and tasty, and dish look it was made for a magazine photoshoot (imagine how much care was it done with), you can tell by my photo. Ken the owner was around and was very friendly, caring and genuinely conversational. He ordered the samples for us. All in all, you feel welcomed, and like family. Thank you, Pomelo! Me and my family had a good time.

B2Enlz_Em8pjUDKoVP3ICA.text: Perfect in every way, great food and very fresh, perfectly priced! The Ambiance and mix of people is exciting. The attached I cream parlor and fun outside yard area goes great with the entire concept.  From a perfect cut of salmon or a burger everything was served quick and fresh. The chocolate cake tastes homemade!   The Pomelo Vodka is very unique!

JR0wLjPC0PURd6z5tHB41g.text: Having had wonderful lunches at Pomelo several times in the past, my husband, myself and a second couple decided to try it for dinner. We were quite disappointed. We were seated outside on the street side of the restaurant where there is a nice fire structure. For some reason, the fire was turned off midway through our meal even though we requested it to be turned back on, as it added ambiance and distraction from the street. Also, once the sun sets, that particular area is not well lit and is quite dark. We ordered drinks, but the wine didn't come out until halfway through the appetizers and the waters took awhile and then not refilled. At the end of our main course, we were given the bill even though we were not offered dessert, which we would have really enjoyed.

_kdgFNvIHBpphav3FLZVzw.text: Nom nom nom!   That's all I have to say really. I have been here twice and both have been fantastic.   Starters are big enough for a real meal. Meals are big enough for left overs.

IDMapEP0N71qSn6b7CgykA.text: This was our first time at Pomelo...it was Fantastic!! We came for Mother's Day Brunch at 10am with reservations! We had an amazing spot on the patio for our brunch. Our server Andrea was Outstanding!! So friendly and knowledgeable about the menu! She made the event more fun with her great attention to details! Our Mimosas were delicious & bubbly! Our breakfasts were exceptional! My daughter and I shared the Crab Cake Benedict- so much crabmeat!! My husband had something that was like breakfast nachos!! Everyone shared the Brussel Sprouts that were good-but a bit hard & over charred for all of us. The atmosphere being on the patio watching everyone enjoying the holiday morning together made it a fantastic brunch! We will definitely come back to try the evening offerings!!

EQRMPKIgRPfyAHY4vmzQlQ.text: I really wanted to fall in love with Pomelo. The charming setting with an extensive, tree-shaded patio is so appealing. The inside is attractive with just enough coziness from the leaf-green leather corner booths and low-key, dreamy landscape paintings to balance the huge windows looking out to said patio. Leather acoustic panels on the ceiling dampen the sound to achieve the right level between sepulchral and manic din. Wanted to love it.  Husband and I arrived on a whim, without reservations, around 6:30 on a Saturday, our wedding anniversary for which we'd made zero plans. Nothing available outside, of course, but a manager overheard us about to leave and offered one of the swanky corner booths that had just opened. These are for just two people, and you sit facing the room. So romantic.  Our charming server took a photo or two of us on my phone, then headed off to put in our appetizer order. And then, we waited.   Okay, a Saturday night, the place was about 3/4 full, a wait is to be expected. But just when I got to the "where the HELL is this appetizer?" point, a server emerged from the kitchen with our entrees and moments later, a woman who appeared to be a manager popped up with the appetizer. Hmmn. She was embarrassed and said so, but no, I didn't want the entrees to go back into the kitchen and sit (I presume). So everything on the table at once. Whatev.  My husband adored his Carnivore pizza. The appetizer, a mix of breaded small shrimp and calimari was just okay. I, however, was seriously underwhelmed with my short ribs. Tough, dry, and bland. The mashed and veggies likewise bland. I'd been hoping for big flavors. Nope.  I finally flagged the manager and explained, and he said they'd remake the dish. Minutes later he re-appeared and apologized, but the entire batch of short ribs was undercooked. He took them off the menu.  So. What instead? I went with salmon with a creamy arugula sauce over roasted fingerling and sweet potatoes. Okay, but the salmon was overdone. I can do better at home (my standard for judging a restaurant).  I'd ordered a glass of sangiovese; it arrived at least 10 too warm. We tried for dessert, decaf for me, and a refill of water glasses. The chocolate cake was meh, with that weird, spongy texture that tells me the baker had never had a decent birthday cake. Not Layercakus Americanus. The coffee was lukewarm, and turned cold once milk was added. I never got the sugar I'd asked for twice, and we never did get water refilled.   Oy. The staff's attitude was lovely, but that's not going to fix mediocre food and serving missteps. The latter were not entirely the fault of our inexperienced server (she'd just finished her training), but keeping water glasses filled is pretty basic, even when the place gets busy. Someone isn't paying attention in the kitchen: there's no way those tough, tasteless short ribs (no pan sauce or gravy, either!) should ever have been plated. And when it comes to seasoning, who's their audience? Someone who thinks brandishing a peppermill is the height of daring?  I suspect that lunch at Luci's in the Orchard, their more casual option geared to salads and sandwiches, would be a more successful meal. But this dinner was just ... meh.

RSFdrr7sKtqqd61_S-agbg.text: Ryan recommended the braised beef shortrib, his description of the meal sounded enticing! My boyfriend ordered the pork chop, I ordered the shortrib, Ryan's recomended meal was delicious, and his service was impeccable. We will come back... one of our new favorites! Thank you for a lovely evening!

1opNFo7MSHXTuotmVvfpfg.text: Went to Pomelo for my friends 30th birthday. We made a reservation for the grass area which staff indicated in advance would not be a problem. From the start, staff was rude and unaccommodating. It took at least 30 min for us to get service for a party of 12. Also to note at this time the restaurant was not busy inside. Water was brought to one end of the table and left for us to distribute amongst ourselves. Also one of the glasses had lip stick marks on it. The server  was not friendly or accommodating - appeared very inexperienced.  I would not recommend this place for any event or large party. They clearly don't know what they are doing and given the type of space it was built to accommodate such.

Yfios1tgz73HPOBSd4Wbfw.text: Visited this place for the first time last night...happy hour date night for my husband and I.  Took a stroll around the place to check it all out, Luci's, the ice cream shop and the outside area before settling in at Pomelo.  First person we were greeted by, a server setting up the patio tables, she was very friendly and welcoming. We sat at the bar, the place was not too crowded, which was surprising for a Friday night...but it was only 5:00 when we arrived. Bartender was quick to take our order, and deliver....again very friendly and anxious to take care of us.  Drinks were delicious - I had a bellisimo and my husband had a sculpin beer (guess you can't really do anything to that but pour, so let's say drink was delicious).  Ordered a couple of appetizers (happy hour $$)  the wood roasted olives -yum! and the calamari both were very good....we followed up by ordering dinners - I had the beet salad and it was HUGE, enough for two, my husband had a customized pizza which he said was fantastic.....so great place, great service will definitely be back!!!  UPDATE: We visited this place last night, and it's amazing how ONE person can change your opinion of a place.  We had a great bartender, she quickly took care of us with water and taking our drink order (sat at the bar).  As we sat there and observed the happenings....one of the bartenders (not ours) got into a somewhat heated discussion with another customer across the bar (something about the bill, to the point that the bartender, very sternly said "I've taken one wine off, OK?")strike one, then the same bartender was upset about there being no "F'n Lemons" loud enough so that I could hear him, (strike two), really that upsets you so much that you demonstrate that in front of customers? then he said something to our bartender about how long she'd been there...next thing we know she's clocking out.  By this time we had already asked for our bill which she promptly brought, but left prior to our credit card being processed...so we waited, and waited, and waited....  I tried to get the attention of "mr friendly bartender"..he was waiting on another customer and said "yeah, hold on"...OK...I've been waiting longer to close out my tab then I did to get my drink (strike THREE).  YOU know if you don't like to deal with customers, or are having a shitty day...STAY HOME don't make the rest of us suffer your pissy poor attitude.  Next visit, if Mr Sunshine is still bartending, we're going to turn right around and leave...

HI0IyayfDbD6Uc44pdaMIQ.text: Food is pretty good but not consistently good. Staff members in the bar area have been friendly, yet the service in the dining areas has been subpar. Ambience is nice inside and out.

V_raYVsFNrMVPAjTCrTBZw.text: First off there were plenty of open tables on a Friday night, should have been the first clue. The best thing about the restaurant was our server was very sweet. We ordered the garlic focaccia which was good. My daughter ordered the brussel sprouts which tasted awful. The house burger has an "aioli" sauce which ruined the burger, to be fair the burger was not good regardless. We ordered the steamed vegetables with the burger & they were not cooked. My daughter then ordered a basic Caesar salad which was average for $17. The best part was the manager stared at our table to the point of uncomfortableness & never came over to speak with us. My family ordered one of the pizzas & it was fine, just a little soggy. Overall, a bad experience, left hungry & will not return.

uH8kkewgEl5fVP2k2-3yvg.text: I love this place! Such a cozy and classy setting.  The food is consistently good and of good quality.  They have a grass fed burger for you paleo folks and they have a pizza and a bottle of wine on Mondays and Tuesdays for $20,  my favorite is the mushroom pizza.  If you're not a big drinker they'll close up the bottle for you and you can take home.  The staff always is so nice and prompt.  This is definitely one of my top 5 favorite places!

QzUQeJp48QmO2oKMZ-LuKw.text: This is our third visit to pomelo and our second review. Once again we had a tremendous experience! Everything we ordered on the menu was delicious, and our server, Ryan, was awesome! We would recommend this place to anybody and everybody that we  know. Well done Pomelo!

P1WITIRMIK7xFQvvqwX-BQ.text: The setting is awesome and the food not bad....the service is awful. Sooooo bad. Waiters and bar tenders blaming each other for delayed service. Our waiter said outer food took 45 minutes because another table wanted to split the bill. He offered to give us free dessert but forgot that because our food took so long the dessert shop closed. Until the owners invest in better service staff, stay far away.

KopMh8YqOI9PmSpIs4bcEA.text: Met a friend after work for a bite. Arrived at 5pm on a Friday and at first were told by the front staff that without a reservation, no tables. Two, at 5 pm? Miraculously they did find us a table, which was great since we did not want to sit in the bar.  Ordered water and a drink, which were delivered promptly enough. We then ordered the Brussel Sprout appetizer, which sounds great on the menu....but is sorely lacking in the execution. Basically, the Brussels sprouts were almost raw...roasting them does not deal with the chewiness if they are not steamed in some way. Finishing them in a little beef broth would have been perfect...but as I realized by the end of the meal, this is the problem with Pomela. They almost get it right....but not quite. The "bacon" in the recipe were bits so small they were almost sub atomic particles; particles that could not be chewed and stuck painfully in my teethwhile also imparting little flavor. The biggest problem with the meals were scant sauces lacking flavor and seriously undercooked vegetables.  I understand al dente, but I don't like raw. Hey chefs, it's okay if the veggies have a little "give". All the veggies in both meals were just over raw, and they could use a lesson on salt, pepper and spices. I had braised short ribs which should have melted in my mouth and been oozing the brazing juices; they were dry and had no juice, and the gravy they did serve was sparse. As for my partner's meal, the prime rib looked good and was properly prepared to order, but again; meh. Most of it went in to go bags where I will doctor mine at home to make it more palatable with some garlic, olive oil and broth.   All in all, the service was fine and the food just okay. I would go possibly for happy hour as my not oft ordered French 75 was very good. The atmosphere was a bit austere to my taste, and as several reveiwers mentioned, on the  manufactured side. As for the food, lots of choices in Phoenix...I will try others before I return, if at all.

QXuCUz9fzJNFayHOAHs9pg.text: I was very disappointed in this restaurant. Not only was the food a disappointment but the service as well. It tasted as if the food was pre-made elsewhere and just heated up and served to our table. The pork chops were overcooked and dry and the vegetables did not seem fresh. The ingredients used on the pizza did not seem fresh and the cheese tasted as if it were a low-quality cheese. Definitely not worth the prices that they charge.

G-Q76DXZDdgCj8-Oa4dvhw.text: The service here is dreadful. My family went about 5 pm on a Saturday night. Restaurant only had a few patrons. Waited 10 mins to be sat. After being sat reminded the server we needed a high chair. Another 10 mins went by. No server. No high chair. Several servers stared at our table, despite making eye contact not one came to our table. I cannot speak to the food since we left before ordering. I should have trusted similar reviews.

M6w81TSOa1qvZdrPhaVrrQ.text: Place is amazing, with great food and ambience.  I will definitely be coming back soon!!

ro852vyLDyb2EiPRoQ7LLQ.text: Came tonight with me 3 year old son while my husband was at work. Initially when we walked in we were told due to reservations - we were a walk in - that we would have a 20-25 minute wait. Obviously, with a three year old, that isn't going to fly. The hostess (stephanie) immediately recognized this and worked her magic to ensure we got a seat. I ordered the Wednesday taco and margarita special for $10 - hands down the best special in town! The fish tacos are the best I have had in Phoenix. My son got the chicken and fries which he loved. The owner Jerry introduced himself and made sure we were comfortable - going as far as bringing paper for my son to draw on. I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone.

rinvt3bxPsGrQ6KRGFhO2g.text: Food is great but service is not good. Great outdoor area to eat and relax. Just don't expect to get attended to.

n9lysh8oT4bPftJ9jRm59w.text: Beautiful restaurant! Enjoyed dinner and wine with great service and ambiance here. Would definitely recommend. Particularly enjoyed the flatbread trio.

Gay1xLB4XCSGlzM9qx6KeA.text: I took a date here for his Birthday and we had a fabulous meal. Our server Ryan was top notch! He really made our entire first time experience a night to remember. Thank you Ryan, you rock!

AAE6USuOvsqqNrh8X71OnQ.text: My mother and I dined at Pomelo on Saturday, November 25. We arrived a little early, so we decided to walk around the grounds and check out Luci's and Splurge. The grounds are simply beautiful!! Just by walking in, I knew we were going to have a great dining experience. When it was time to report to the hostess stand to check in, we were greeted by the hostess, who swung the door open as if she were anxiously awaiting our arrival. Once we were seated, our waitress took great care of us throughout the meal, even bringing a complimentary slice of cheesecake since Mum and I were there to celebrate my birthday (albeit a week after the fact). We shared the hummus appetizer, the chopped salad, and the roasted salmon entree.  All of our food was outstanding! Perfectly prepared, well presented, and absolutely delicious. The ambiance made the whole experience that much more special. We will definitely return!

rHfrf158bR2Aghd-3WBHAw.text: 4 times in a row now, I am making reservations ahead and asking to be seated on the patio to enjoy the outdoors. Each time I come in and get told that they can only seat me inside because the outside is full. The second to last time for my friends birthday with a party of 8, we made reservations 3 weeks ahead and asked to be seated outside. A large party had just left and they told us they can't seat us outside because they need to separate to the tables to give them to others that came in without a reservation. The following time I came for a wedding anniversary and they said it will be an hour wait to be seated outside even though we had reservations ahead of time. I asked why she cant seat us at the table that was open, she said it is a 4 top and can't seat 2 people only. Literally 20 minutes later, she seats a couple (party of 2) at that same table that were just a walk in. I was so upset that this kept happening that I finally brought it to the managers attention, who could not care less how we felt. He said he had an issue with the girl upfront, and next time to just say the manager said its fine to sit on the patio. Literally wouldn't even look me in the eye. There won't be a next time, thats for sure!!!

pv-2NLKA3zzE2u-dZBtCvQ.text: First time here and was for brunch. Really enjoyed it the "campus" atmosphere was special. Will come back for some outdoor time as it was just a bit chilly for me. It was surprisingly unbusy for a Sunday in January; service good. I could imagine that it might get noisy inside if busy. Note that parking can be a problem here.

MvK6y86DBumbLJlr8p2WdQ.text: This place is absolutely adorable and when the weather is nice outside I don't think you could pick a better spot ! We started with the calamari which was great and cooked perfectly. The pizzas were all very good and cooked perfectly as well. Prime rib special was fabulous! All the drinks were great and it looked like they had a great happy hour menu! I will be back for sure.

00Pt-7LK2oB5eOke_W0dXA.text: Pomelo is a lovely organic homegrown restaurant in the shadow of Squaw Peak in Phoenix Arizona.  One of three styles of cafes built within the theme of the old Orchard farmhouse that existed there years ago.   The menu offers everything from smoked salmon carpaccio on a bed of arugula to grass-fed organic meats. Veggies eaters will also find a full selection of delicious healthy food options.   In addition to their daily fine dining options, Pomelo has two exclusive elegant rooms for an array of private events.   With a full bar and plenty of food options, this restaurant will surely impress.

ydPAlMZ9T2Q0DZ9CbvnEVg.text: Had a fantastic Tuesday afternoon taking advantage of their $25 bottle of wine and pizza Tuesday special. Besides the incredible value, the service, ambiance and libations, the pizza was superb.   A great place to hold a business meeting at. I started out at the bar with a gin and tonic. The bartender was a friendly as they come. We then made it to our table. Thanks for the incredible table service. #dukeofeats.

FjdPbjdmLSZD5woVzzP3Xg.text: Nice team lunch at Pomelo on 12th Street north of Glendale Ave in Phoenix. Pomelo is  located next to Luci's at the Orchard. Great setting in a former citrus orchard. Easy parking and excellent service. Lunch menu was small but enough options for all. No cappucino coffee. Most of the people had sandwichs, fish tacos and I had the Ahi Salad.  Apps included roasted brussel sprouts and a  breaded calamari dish. The sprouts were good. I did not eat the calamari. Ahi salad was good but a bit bland for my palate.  Probably can kick it up with a ginger miso dressing.  The roasted beet salad looked good on the menu.   Overall a pleasant dining experience. Outside seating looked very inviting in cooler days. Great addition to this north Phoenix neighborhood. Worth another trip to try the roasted beet salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside Seating Under the Trees
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi Salad
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Brussel Sprouts

6EBugj-PB-a6u-YR2tQNrQ.text: Dinner was good, food was good, service was good. They handled our allergy and dietary restrictions well (mainly why 4 not 3 stars). Overall just good. Nothing amazing about this spot. Usually I'm at the orchard for Luccis and this place gets I overlooked. And now I see why..sort of for good reason. I'd suggest going on Mon or Tues though when they have their wine & pizza specials. Their chocolate cake dessert though was very scrumptious and a bite each made everyone happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

i-pekhjZpXt1NvAkLTQiFg.text: Service was prompt. The moment we walked in we were greeted. We were sat right away and brought refreshments. Everything on their menu sounds delicious. I was going to go for a salad but the Brussel sprouts and wings sounded too good to pass up.  The Brussel sprouts were delicious. They were my favorite. The wings were good too. My friend enjoyed his French dip. The bread seemed the perfect texture and there was just the right amount of meat. Definitely will go there again to try the salads. Everyone seemed to be ordering salads or their pizzas.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creme brûlée
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PZO0Wm7A_6kg1jdVt9P-CQ.text: Always a good dinner at Pomelo! This past Saturday was my fiance and I's second time, and so far we have always had a great experience. The servers are super friendly and attentive, and give you that fancy restaurant feel :)  The first time we came with my fiance's family, I had the Carnivore pizza which I thought was really good, and he had the Amazing French Dip (which he didn't find amazing to be honest lol, but his brother really liked it). Other than that people had the burger and different pastas, and everyone seemed to like their food. We also had really good appetizers - I would recommend the Blistered Brussel Sprouts and Garlic Focaccia!   This past weekend, to try something different, we started with the Calamari & Shrimp Fritti, which was delicious. We always love calamari, and the Pomodoro sauce was really good (normally I don't care for the sauce you get with calamari, but this isn't just cocktail sauce or whatever, it's spicy and has good flavor). For dinner, I got the Roasted Chicken and my fiance got the Pasta Bolognese. We both really liked them, and you get a lot of sirloin in the pasta! You get a big serving of chicken, too, and the mashed potatoes are delicious. :)   So far we've only been here in the fall and winter, but I can't wait to come again in the spring to sit on the patio. The fireplace outside is so pretty!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta Bolognese
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Calamari &amp; Shrimp Fritti
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Chicken

WiIO0-PVqBKRQNt964EHQg.text: Decent spot in North Central Phoenix for a good family dining and pretty predictable food. Came here with a group of six and appreciated their willingness to get us in with a days notice.  Really enjoyed a host of appetizers from hummus to the cheeseboard to Mexican corn and brussels sprouts.All prepared really well and very satisfying.  For an entree, had the pork chop which was big but on the dry side although the sauce was really delicious. After all the appetizers, only needed to eat half which was good because I wasn't really enjoying what turned out to be a pretty tough dry slab of meat.  Will definitely come back here and order a bit more carefully - heard from across the table the salmon was good and service was very strong.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop.

DL9fCS0dKxA0K8xFHKFrvg.text: Such a great dining experience! Eric was very helpful polite and friendly. The salmon was amazing! The pizza was phenomenal! Steak salad and chicken wings were exceptional! Zero complaints and we will be back next time we're in Phoenix

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beet salad
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pepperoni pizza &amp; harvest salad
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salmon with potatoes, broccoli and Butternut squash

XLAb6RlOR0dJXzrhVJEG-Q.text: There are local restaurants that you can't help but root for. What a cool concept. They have  thought of everything.  The restaurant is savory and I feel the options to be pretty exceptional . Lots of vegetarian options to carnivore options.  Thursday is burger and brew for $16.  Huge burger, 16 oz beer and fries.  Monday/Tuesday is pizza and bottle wine for $25,  Awesome prices and you'll leave happy.  Spinach dip was hearty, Brussel sprouts (omg) good, grass fed burger is huge.  Soup of the day was specifically made vegetarian base and done honestly superb in flavor.  The restaurant is in a residential type area. The history of the property is cool. I remember what it was beforehand.   There is a meeting room for 16 guests up stairs, a big meeting/party room in the basement, a wedding venue or a great company party venue outside.  Everything is locally resourced and they have their own Pomelo vodka which after taste is like a tangerine crossover. Best vodka shot for those who need a quick release or wake up.   I absolutely recommend this place. The owners deserve our business because they are doing everything they can to build a diverse welcoming and community hip place for customers to enjoy.  Its family oriented with a kiddie water area while parents enjoy a coffee or treat.  They have splurge which is their award winning ice cream shop. Then they have pomelo for people like me who enjoy a good craft brew or drink with a very hearty and flavorful appetizer.   Thanks Ken, Luci, Jerry and Michelle for going above and beyond just because you genuinely care about those who choose to frequent your business.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great daily deals
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

uXXG63wu9eJbqNv6ri-IXg.text: While in Phoenix, I met up with some friends at the Orchard, and we happened to be hungry. Well, wouldn't you know it that Pomelo happened to have a $25 wine and pizza deal on Mondays!   It was pretty empty at that hour and we sat in the patio, however the lawn was preparing for a political event, so there was lots of people watching.  We ordered a bottle of red wine and a mushroom pizza. Good wood-fire burning and decent wine- was definitely worth it for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wo-2eXbRr2-fdWzncmQukw.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE.   This place is so cute and hipster but every time I come here the service is terrible.    When we entered the restaurant at 8 the host told us the few areas we could sit because they were closing soon (they close at 9). He took us to our table and you could tell he was upset that we wanted to stay and eat. It 20 minutes for someone to even get our drink order. When it came to our food order the waiter said you better get in your order the kitchen closes in 10 min. Which means it closes at 830....   The food was good as always but the service just always ruins the night.   I honestly don't get why the staff here is so rude. The food and ambiance is so nice but it is ruined by the horrible service. Something needs to change.

QoC1_PVw_FZjfHHqzbfs2w.text: So, we have given this place many, many tries. We have come for brunch, lunch, and dinners. I really wanted to have a good experience because it's so stinkin cute and I love the ambiance.   Sadly, tonight, we left before we even got water. The service, once again, was dreadful. The hostess was either new, overwhelmed,  or just slow. We sat in the dining room with only 3 other tables occupied, had probably 4 different walk-bys by wait staff, and no one stopped to say they would be right with us, sorry for the wait...nothing. We had already experienced poor service several times in the past so we knew this was looming like it would be the same so we finally left.   As far as the food....the weekend brunch, in my opinion,  is meh. No flavor at all.  I tried several things on several occasions and they just weren't that good...some I even sent back for the blandness. Chilaquiles...bland...sent it back. Salad...no flavor. Seared Ahi salad...nope...bland. Chopped salad...again...bland. Even the mimosas aren't good...tastes like they use frozen orange juice concentrate. The dinner menu looked promising but didn't stay long enough to try.   I will give credit to the cinnamon roll...it's amazing!  Again, if you have hours to dawdle, don't mind having to track down your server, don't mind kinda meh food, don't mind the bartender being your server and not being very available, but you love great ambiance I'd say go for it.   Really...we gave this place many tries because I really want to love it...but we have just had way too many disappointing service experiences and so so food to ever try again.

QU57vav3ayLNedLZKLBqqA.text: Wonderful!!! Had brunch there yesterday.  I live over on the east side. I'd drive to Phoenix just for their Carnivore pizza. Beer selection is non existent.  Cocktails is their jam.  Food was reasonable. Wait staff was excellent. My buddy and his girlfriend had a flash wedding here and the staff rolled with it. I was really impressed.  It's a really neat complex with another bar and restaurant. The ice cream shop is treat as well.

xaheRKsNruitbu1Eq3VDgw.text: 4 1/2 stars. Pomelo is the nice, modern little restaurant located in The Orchard, along with Splurge (ice cream), and Luci's at The Orchard.  I got the gluten free pizza (pepperoni [ricotta on pepperoni pizza, why is no one else making this a thing?!?! so fantastic]).  I've been gluten free for nearly two years due to a health issue and this is the best dang pizza I've had since going GF.  They make their own crust, using a sourdough starter.  It is not your typical ultra-thin gluten free crust.  It is a little thick (my favorite type) and has a nice crispy crust & edge.  It even reheated fairly well with micro & toaster oven (to recrisp).  This will be my new favorite place for pizza.  My husband got the burger, with all the glutenous rich brioche bun, and said it was delicious.  The fries (also GF) were a bit soggy.  Hoping this was a one-off incident.  I'd love to try the burger sans bun, but I'll be hard pressed to get it when I loved the pizza as much as I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger &amp; fries. Gluten free pepperoni pizza .

21uLxCahI-H8yXAqt7oZrw.text: Came here for brunch with family one Sunday. We heard about this little place from a friend and could not have been more happier with the food** Why do I put asterisks? Because the food was awesome, I docked a star because the experience was not too great. It's November and no where has better November weather than Arizona, so why not open all the sliding doors to the patio open? If you come and the doors are open, SIT OUTSIDE. I can't tell you how many flies we were swatting away! The entire meal from when we got our drinks until the end when we were finishing our cinnamon roll!  Somehow no one outside was having this issue, just us sitting in the corner inside.  Don't get me wrong, the food was delicious! And the service was kind. But those dang flies were beyond frustrating.

OYBbDmJuWpXwuyZsiBMwtA.text: This is an amazing little spot up in Phoenix. Cool outdoor seating and a cute interior. We went for a Sunday brunch and were super pleased with all our choices. The breakfast pizza was spot on, and the homemade cinnamon roll was one of the best I've had at a restaurant in a long time. Nice and warm and covered in frosting and caramel drizzle.
