Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon roll
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast pizza

Z2ola822SgOttpfjWHcL9g.text: Can't beat their Monday-Tuesday specials of pizza and wine, also their smoked salmon carpaccio is a must have!  We will be returning!

sUnjunJn71YWt1zaGXoAyA.text: The food was not as good as it should have been or for what it cost. We ordered three appetizers, one of which was the artichoke dip. Either it didn't get enough time to heat it up or it sat away from the heat lamp before it was served - but it was tepid at best. My entree (halibut, it was terrible, more on that in a minute) was also served tepid, or barely room temperature. The halibut tasted like it had been in the freezer for awhile and then over cooked to compensate . The hostess came by and asked how our food was - when I mentioned that the halibut was not good, she did immediately fix it and replaced it with salmon. But I sat for 10 minutes with no food while they fixed it.   Overall not horrible. But Not Good, especially considering the price point.

QIE78VsZlM-NjzCb5krlAQ.text: This is a beautiful setting close to downtown Phoenix but on a quiet street. Outdoor seating is plentiful, indoor seating for 2 4 6 or 8 people is easily accommodated. Monday and Tuesday is pizza and wine for $25. if you don't finish the wine they will cork it and send it home with you. They have about five good pizzas to choose from. The meat lovers was covered with sausage, pepperoni, and was very tasty. The mushroom pizza had caramelized onions cheese garlic and reduced balsamic. It was very tasty. My husband had the Ahi tuna salad which had quinoa and avocado. It was very flavorful and would be very highly recommended. Prices range from minimum $12 to about $25. The wine choices are plentiful. Service was very good, attentive, and knowledgeable. The bathroom was impressive with special tile on the floor that made me smile. See photos for details.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ahi tuna salad and mushroom caramelized onion pizza Prices range $15 for the salad and $25 for pizza and a bottle of wine.
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the entrances. We sat under this large tent to visit while it was raining outside.
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Check out this bathroom floor in the ladies room!

-G2s0YJsvwqFidXIZsW8cQ.text: We've come here on multiple occasions and have had a great experience each time. The complex in which Pomelo is located is beautiful and service is always friendly, helpful, and quick. Food is always delicious with good portion sizes.  Never a bad bet if you're in the area or are looking for something new to try in Phoenix.

RYqO0EJ43iryKt_qo_bfXw.text: We held our son's wedding rehearsal dinner for 48 people here. What was I disappointed in? Nothing at all! What did I like? Since I am from out of town, I made most of the arrangement long distance, and Linda Schnitzer, my planner, could not have done a better job, from the logistics of the dinner, to the food and drink recommendations and coordinating the service at the night of the dinner. Nothing fazed her helpful, cheery demeanor. She was sensitive to price all through the planning and we got lots of value for our $. For example the entrees were fettuccine/pasta dishes, generous buffet servings, and the guests raved about the food. The service timing and attention were excellent. Every detail was addressed both before and during the dinner by Linda and Amanda and the servers. I will be going back whenever I want to treat myself to a charming, garden relaxed setting that is an isle of tranquility in north central Phoenix. Thank you, Pomelo!!!

zEQbexvsbDcsomLt6qf8pg.text: This restaurant should be a five star all the way, based purely on the quality of the food and the obvious investment in their build out!   Unfortunately, our server was nowhere near friendly, and the lighting was so bright it appeared like a cafeteria! We nicely asked the server four times if they would dim the lighting before they finally did, and then within a moment or two it was turned back up.   The food was absolutely amazing! It's a shame they can't find friendly servers, and dial-in the ambiance.

b3veEAr3P-nYV3J62YLH7Q.text: This place is really nice, close to my house I really want it to be good because it is convenient for me. The service is good. I have been here 4 times. The only problem is that the food is horrible, everything is over salted and over priced. The drinks are not good either.  All this place needs to be great is a good cook & bartender... Unfortunately I only come here for food and drinks.

eDCHxwI9YhDkl4kDl5aM-w.text: Great spot for a relaxed happy hour.  Lots of parking and bike racks.  Love it!

FHZPdLhkwxLF4g8nUxR--g.text: Love the atmosphere.  Food is tasty and arrived as described.  Service was speedy and friendly.

dOim7E_x3Nktc1oJwlesIA.text: Awful food and customer service! Please be warned of this place. From first glance this place appears quaint and cozy, but that is the best part of experience.   We were invited to a birthday party that was hosted there. The restaurant staff was rude to our party about the reservation, and didn't recall the reservation that was filed a month prior. In addition, the server seemed to forget our table of 12 at times.   When the waters were brought to the table, they were left on one end of the table for us to distribute to each other. In addition, one of the glasses had a lipstick mark still on the rim of the glass.   Our party ordered several different dishes. I had ordered two types of pizza. The crust was burnt with both. In addition, the pizza was over priced and mediocre at best.   I will not be returning to this place. There needs to be a re-evaluation done over their products and customer service.

elc6PnaFuxzn4TFgLKqwrg.text: Took the family over Friday morning for brunch And I must say I'm very impressed with there customer service, they are very friendly and welcoming the food was delicious! we didn't had to wait long for our food,  the time they took was decent , I'm very happy and pleased with this restaurant I will definitely will be dining here more often. I Recommend it to everyone

wJOhy9llP7TtCKjJX5cG9g.text: What a fun place.  We had a group and rented the Barn for a private party.  Great Italian food from Pomelo.   The kids walked around in the park and then went to Splurge for ice cream.  Really nice setting.   Since then we have gone to Luci's for lunch and picked up some things at the store.  Lot of fun, take the family.

aHpIehbX0nGMjIfoC1_6vQ.text: Two experiences at this restaurant. Both excellent!  First was a Saturday brunch to plan a Friday night party.  We held our party last night. Could not be a better experience.  We had wonderful service and excellent food.  Last night I had the pork chop which was marvelous. The french dip looked amazing as did the pizza. Our appetizer was the chef's board with meats cheeses and assorted compliments. Tried pickled grapes. Out of this world! I don't like pickled foods. But these grapes....want more please! We will be back. This is a jewel of a location. Appreciate the elegance of the food with the laid back casual neighborhood vive.

P_rRoyaG4Mfwy_ds3NsD1g.text: Ate here for the first time! The food was very good and the overall atmosphere of the restaurant was very nice! The outdoor area was very appealing and the fire pits were awesome!  Had the Cod for dinner and it was very good!! Look forward to coming back!

RIeVcCh2pRpLVvFo-PEhpQ.text: I still love this place! The food, the ambiance, the service! I think the servers are amazing! Ethan, Justin, Jeremy, Shannon and Alysha just to name a few! It's nice to see familiar faces. Their service is so on point! Their menu knowledge is excellent and they always welcome me with a smile. Jerry, one of the owners is so friendly and seems to have a fun, working relationship with the employees. However, the other owner Ken is so awkward when he approaches us. It's like he's expecting us to say we are having a bad time. I'm not a huge fan how he talks to the employees. He's not around very much, so that's a good thing. The only time I ever had an issue is when I tried too book a party for my daughter's wedding shower. I never received a call back after several phone calls. I had to end up booking another venue. My daughter was very disappointed.

hIOuxuM0WFqZzCOFPqjpbw.text: The place is a nice neighborhood restaurant / bar. The first impression was that it was fresh and new. The staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant.

eUVArOP1TP_XCO4p9VozwQ.text: Wow! First time here and we will definitely be back! My fiancee found an article in the newspaper about it so we thought we would check it out! The food was incredible and the service was wonderful, too! Megan took great care of us, and Frankie made sure we had everything we needed! We had the salmon and short ribs and they both were incredible! Next time we will skip the apps...although they were amazing...so we have room for gelato next store! It looked so good, but we were stuffed! Great place for couples, families, friends! Different seating whatever u are looking for! The orange blossoms in the courtyard were intoxicating! Can't wait to go back!

e994a3JUSFFnk0qY6K9SbQ.text: This is one of my favorite places ever! I come for their wine and pizza deal every once in a while and I must say Mike is the best bartender of all. He has a great personality and look so he rocks! Best one of them all! Also the food is amazing and so is my Pinot Grigio :) amazing everything

a4IWBGR7F2oSINJBUg-NCg.text: Pomelo maybe a victim of its own success. Have been about 10 times and as they are getting more popular the service and quality of the meals is deteriorating. Have had 3 poor experiences in a row...poor service, cold food and items on the special not being available after ordering. I love the setting, but now hesitate to recommend.

xKsUMCN6Oy-kND1F4hCMtQ.text: This is my second time to eat at this new north central enclave.  The first time I had lunch and this time I had dinner with three other friends.  First, let me say the atmosphere is incredible!  Lots of space both indoor and outdoor, as well as some nice private dining rooms.  The colors are way cool and add a nice warm ambience.  There is a great bar and an adjoining living room with a working fireplace to wait for your table.  We sat in a booth and our waitress Sherrie was very accommodating to us the entire evening.    We started with the spinach & artichoke appetizer with chips and it was delicious and plenty for sharing.  We had cocktails and ordered our entree's.  I had the pork ribs that come with French fries and home made cole slaw.  Let me say the portion was WAY too much and I had plenty left over to take home with me.  The others in my party enjoyed their entree's too (one had a pizza, one had the beet salad with chicken and one had the NY Strip).  We shared the peach shortbread dessert and that was the only somewhat disappointing thing of the evening.  The "shortbread" was more like a store bought angel food cake than True shortbread and the peaches were not fresh peaches, but it was still a tasty ending to a delicious meal.    This is going to be a very crowded place once the weather cools down so go now and love it while you can!

d1OzJfGOmH8HDxbhY5DeAg.text: This is my new favorite neighborhood place! Place is adorable, staff is very welcoming, and food is delicious. I had the spicy mule and meat and cheese board to start. Delicious! I look forward to returning, and am excited to have another great place in the neighborhood. Meat and cheese board was a little small for the 18.00 price tag, but very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese and meat board and spicy mule!
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6kx96597pEtQW4jlZsxJRA.text: Wonderful service & delicious food - I will be back! I split the prime rib with an additional side of seasonal veggies with a friend and it was just the perfect amount for each of us. The horseradish had the best bit of bite to it and my sinuses were cleared up in the best way possible :)  The garlic potatoes were a bit creamier than I like, but they were still flavourful. We had the small room reserved for a group of 10. Split checks were not an issue, in fact they were offered. Since we were celebrating a graduation, the chef gave us complimentary dessert.... and not the typical one dessert that everyone splits. I'm talking three large desserts so everyone had a generous portion. I think it was a bread pudding with ice cream/gelato on top. I said I'd have just one bite but ended up eating a lot more than one - it was so good!  They also have $5 cocktails all of July, so take a Lyft :)

Yk5sFAC20337hx7KgZs55A.text: We had been dying to try out Pomelo after visiting the ice cream shop and Luci's a few weeks before that.  We made reservations for Sunday brunch and were promptly seated in the beautifully appointed dining room.  I enjoyed an egg white veggie omelet and a few pineapple mimosas - so delicious!  I loved everything about this place - the food, the service, the decor and the fun vibe both inside and out.

_Gp9hZgX6zkz3TuP6kZoeQ.text: I really want to love this place, but the food was just not good.  The setting, atmosphere, and staff were great but the food is lacking.  We had 3 bruschetta and while the bread had grill marks to appear like it was heated, it was room temperature and soft.  I had the short ribs which were tough and flavorless.  They were served over an extremely large portion of polenta as well as some potatoes and vegetables.  I thought it was weird they served polenta and potatoes on the same dish.  My wife had the spicy fettuccini that per the menu includes asparagus but for whatever reason didn't include it.  We were short on time so we didn't send anything back.  I'd be open to going back but I'd have to try something different.

cVA0lMfOulf6qqHFQIGiyQ.text: Had a fantastic dinner at Pomelo with good friends on Sunday evening. First, the vibe of The Orchard is unbeatable in Central Phoenix. It fits really well into the neighborhood, and is great for people of all ages. Pomelo itself sits on the south side of the property, inhabiting an original home with an addition. The atmosphere is cozy, with great architectural detailing and attention to detail. Our table shared the spinach dip and wings for appetizers. The spinach was delicious, although it would've been a bit better if it stayed warm longer. The wings were some of the best we've had, a nice combinations of spicy with a little heat and great flavor. For dinner I had the pepperoni pizza. Loved the added ricotta on top, and the ingredients all tasted really good. Everyone else at my table seemed to really enjoy their meal. We will definitely be frequenting Pomelo and look forward to the other concepts opening to fill out this beautifully done space.

KOyUDGHYIb7J1rexC9kzTQ.text: Tried for a second time after a dismal first visit.  To be fair, the first visit was when the restaurant was new.  This time, I found the ambience comfortable, staff friendly.  We ordered the spinach dip for an appetizer, my husband and I ordered a salad "to start" (key words) and a pizza.  Our companions each ordered the halibut with a side of vegetables and a salad "to start".  Our waitress clarified that they each wanted the halibut dish.  Well, first we received the side of vegetables (about 15 minutes before the appetizer)??  Then we received the spinach dip.  After a few minutes, all of the food came to the table at once.  We indicated that we had wanted to start with our salads, not the veggies. They took the pizza, two halibuts and veggies (veggies by now had been sitting on the table for 30 minutes - back to the kitchen, presumably to put under the heat lamp).  The salad was fresh and tasty.  However, when the food came back, as expected, the halibut was completely dried out.  Our companion did state that it had a nice flavor.  Please note, however, when the food came back, there was only one halibut.  We contacted the waitress who seem befuddled as to what had happened to our other halibut.  Short story, they had to remake the halibut and our companion ended up eating by himself.  Too bad they haven't gotten their kitchen timing down.  Our pizza was soggy and greasy as it too had sat under the heat lamp.  I will say, that I have found lately, that it is imperative as a diner than you indicate your preference to eat your starter before the actual meal.  Many restaurants these days tend to bring all of the food out at once, which I do not enjoy as it makes you feel rushed.  Given the flavor, I'm hoping Pomelo can somehow get on track.

lQkKmf6eqy0WfPDObs28Zw.text: Atmosphere is great, and the food is even better. The Manager Frankie introduced himself as soon as we arrived and answered all the questions that we had. Both the manager and staff were very friendly. Great place to grab some food/drinks and hang out with friends.

pGD2fc8E4GB4YHw-uo4Qhw.text: I was very surprised and pleased to be contacted by the management of Pomelo after posting my original review. The manager took responsibility for what happened that day but promised me that it was completely contrary to the goal of Pomelo for any customer to walk away dissatisfied. He also said that changes had been made to address issues at the restaurant that had resulted in my awful experience. I was offered a gift card if I would return to give them another chance.   How can you turn that down? Of course I would return! My schedule is crazy, so it took me awhile but tonight we finally made it back. We were immediately seated on the patio to enjoy what could be one of the last tolerable evenings before the summer heat sets in. We were immediately greeted by our server, Taron who was great the whole night. We had pizza and a French Dip (yaaay-a good French Dip!) with drinks. Everything was fantastic and the atmosphere and service were as well.   Big props to Pomelo's staff for not being afraid to apologize and make big changes. We will be back.

Tgwlw9AFt-x5gT5QGHsyhA.text: I first gave Pomelo 5 stars. Now, after my visit in May '17  I need to revise my review.  The reservation was messed up, the person at the front rolled her eyes on me, (as someone who spent 15 years in customer service, I'd say: this is not your place to do that...)  The food:  this time everything was bland.  Salads were dry, my friend's steak overcooked, potatoes had no salt, no flavor.  Nothing was addressed even though she told the server about it.  (I need to add, that some servers there give, a hands down, 5 star service) I still may be back for pizza, since I like the Orchard and it's near me, but I wish I was more excited about eating there.

5zZkWMRJgZgEPdWzcIy5VA.text: OMG! We held our rehearsal dinner at Pomelo on 9/21/18 and it was out of this world!!!! Linda Schnitzer, the event coordinator, as well as the entire staff, made the entire evening spectacular! The customer service was impeccable, the kindness and generosity of the owners and the entire staff was like no other! The food was the BEST FOOD I've had in a very long time and everything was simply perfect. This is coming from someone who is a perfectionist and it takes a lot to impress me! everything from the flowers on the tables, to the table setups, to the lighting, to the ambience, to the tiny title details that pomelo included was beyond measure. We had a feeling it would be a beautiful evening, but we had no idea it would rock our world like it did! I could go on and on, but if you're thinking about doing a special event anywhere, this place is it. They go above and beyond (I checked out many places) and they set the bar! I HIGHLY recommend Pomelo - you will NOT be disappointed!!!!! :)

iwxYH7Cu7i-GoX-lBXFk2Q.text: Hosted a baby sprinkle here. Got great customer service when planning the event. The room was perfect for our event and staff were very attentive and accommodating. Food was delicious!  Would recommend for a meal or to host an event!

8lZwtC6mqEVY9z2LPTO0xA.text: 7/3/18 Update: They've ironed out the kinks and this is a decent neighborhood restaurant. Brunch is delicious, but can't compete with all the "bottomless mimosas" and "make your own Bloodys" in the area. Had dinner at the bar recently and thought TJ was a creative and friendly bartender, but has the attention span of an ant. He forgot everything and we had to ask for things numerous times.   After driving by this new project, The Orchard, for a year, I finally checked it out with a friend. It was the second weekend since its opening and the new-ness was evident. The grounds are gorgeous: Lots of outdoor seating, grassy area, misters, and a fun family ambiance. Pomelo, one restaurant in the Orchard development, was packed at 5:30 pm on a Friday. It has a dining room, bar, "blue" room, patios, and a private cellar that I didn't see. We sat in the blue room which is sort of a bar area where all servers take care of all customers. There are couches, tables, and a cool giant brass light fixture. Unfortunately the service was really slow and we had to ask for service 2-3 times. They were out of a wine we wanted, an appetizer, and an entree. It was 6 PM on Friday, so chalk that up to poor planning/ordering. They served the wrong wine once, but then didn't charge us for the mistake. We had the meat & cheese tray which was delicious. A Caesar salad and the halibut for dinner were both tasty. I thought the food menu was a little small-I would like to see more items. We weren't offered a drink menu, so I don't know if that exists. But the wine list was good with adequate variety and price range. Pomelo has great potential, they just need to better train their waitstaff and do a better job with inventory. I hope to raise my rating once Pomelo irons out the kinks.

OEunYPs5ggWcW3UMXwAE-g.text: Visited Pomelo last night with my fam. We loved the location and ambiance. Service was great too! They were attentive and kind. We ordered the street corn and Brussels sprouts for appetizers. Everything was very good. For our entrees, we ordered the salmon and the salmon (lol). One is grilled salmon with veggies and the other is their salmon app--both were very good. My only suggestion would be to add more of all of the sauces/flavors. Everything had this deliciousness, but it was like a tease because you want more! Our table was a bit tight for us. We ended up spilling our wine because it was kinda tight. All good though- we will most definitely be back! Thank you!

OFnZ-ipuuVpovjH72caqIg.text: The Monday and Tuesday special is a bottle of wine and their thin crust pizza for $20. What is not to love about that? This is a great space to catch up with friends or just have a quiet dinner alone. The ambience is comfortable yet trendy. I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

stOCS0I1UzuskOOg0GKkdw.text: Excellent service and food.   I look forward to future visits here!  The evening was perfect for outdoor dining and Pomelo did not disappoint.   Interior  seating might be a little noisy for some, so plan and  reserve accordingly.

UrVS2CMlQpEnGoh39aec7Q.text: From the moment I heard about Pomelo, I was excited to try it. I finally made it over for brunch with a group of friends. The decor of the restaurant is super cute and the restaurant opens up to a great patio creating a sort of indoor/outdoor dining feel. For brunch, I tried the eggs benedict. When the dish came out, the eggs were overcooked (cooked hard... not a good look), BUT Pomelo saved itself by quickly taking the dish back and remaking the eggs. The dish was tasty... maybe not the best bene around, but not bad. I also tried the breakfast pizza, which was alright, but not something I would order. I would go back, but it wouldn't be my number one breakfast place in the valley.

q_HFBrvMc4Bp1fIYBN_FrA.text: First time and have to say the setting in the groves was beautiful combined with great spirit drinks! Manager Michelle was very accommodating . The list of the food to die for and my pasta bolognese has unbelievable natural flavors!

9F1yXcFitujYFzOhVBwkow.text: Ever wonder how far $56 will go at Pomelo's? I'll tell you. One appetizer, 2 salads (one with salmon) and 1 glass of wine. Yep....$56. Maybe it wouldn't have been so bad if they put more dressing on the salad. I'm a healthy eater and don't care for heavy, fatty dressings but come on. You could barely taste the lemon vinaigrette.  Other reviews mentioned poor customer service. Our waitress was attentive and I didn't see other tables having to wait long for service. The music was really good.   Here is a piece of friendly advice: EXPAND YOUR GLUTEN FREE NON MEAT OPTIONS!!! Thank you.

q2Tw4yj29S-6NgwgfIIhYg.text: Always very friendly service. Their menu isn't very vegan friendly so that's unfortunate. I hope they include more vegan options to their menu so I can come more often.

HViO1o0U-7Gdl_ppdGZjOg.text: Horrible service!! I've been here twice now and seems to be just how it is. This weekend I was entertaining out of town guests and thought I'd give Pomelo another try and made a reservation for us to sit on the patio.   When we arrived we were seated in the back of the inside, despite there being open tables on the patio. I spoke up, but was told that they couldn't accommodate us because the employee who took my reservation neglected to write down my one simple request.   The waitress promised to "make it up to us" but never did. Simple good service or an app on the house would have done the trick. Instead, she brought our drinks (mostly non alcoholic) after our food arrived, and our food came our at all different times. Also our drinks were not refilled one time.   Overall I was embarrassed we brought our guests here to the "nice patio with amazing Phoenix weather." The food was just so so and overpriced in my opinion. There are so many great spots in central Phoenix that you can skip this place- or if you're really curious about the quaint outdoor space, just get a $6 coffee from Lucis and call it a day.

50Ej8bYiWzKgXBsOq20_Sg.text: I have been contacted by the folks at Pomelo, though I have not had time to respond..but credit to them for offering a conversation and a return on their dime to try them again.   I will update!!!

0WF9mQgKy0c3zlaxY_2-cg.text: Really good quality of food, fresh ingredients.  Nice atmosphere.  Great menu selections.  The pizza is great!

7N311N31z3G1EIvENWCcVg.text: This was my second time here. The first time was at the bar for happy hour and apps, so I wanted another visit before I reviewed.  This time we came for lunch and sat outside. The service was very good and the ambience outside is wonderful.  The food--pretty average.    We ordered the chopped salad and it was missing half the ingredients.  Missing ingredients were:  feta, edamame, raisins, and sunflower seeds.  Also, the only evidence of dinosaur kale was a few slivers (I'm talking quarter inch slivers) mixed in with the other greens (side note: Dinosaur Kale is the first ingredient on the menu for this salad).  We brought the matter to the attention of our server who brought us everything on a side plate except the seeds and edamame (they were out) and we proceeded to build our salad to match the menu description.  also they only brought size of missing ingredients for one salad even though both salads were missing half the ingredients. I added AHI to my salad and while generous in portion, it was bland.  The color seemed off (see picture).  If you look at the salad section on the website menu, there is a picture of the Ahi and that is no where near what today's ahi resembled.  When it was time for the check, the server offered to buy us dessert or a beer, but we declined.  The chopped salad with the AHI add-on was $23.  For that price, it better be perfect.  It was far from it.  Our lunch (2 salads--one with protein add-on, side of fries, two draft beers) came to $65 after tax and tip.  The experience did not match our expectations for that price point.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ZE1G9_ACl2OYR3t1d6okDQ.text: Pomelos is my most favorite spot in Phoenix. First the twinkle lights warm my heart. Their pizza is soooooo good. The jalapeno mule cannot be replicated anywhere else. I would get married here!

mgJF78ABxYsNYRRU-vaRow.text: What a fun place to celebrate.  We took a large group here to celebrate a birthday.  The atmosphere is intimate and inviting.  The food is excellent.  The waitstaff courteous and attentive.  We made the reservations midday on a Friday and were able to get a table for that evening.  We had an issue with an allergy due to the menu, but it has completely been addressed by management to ensure no one could have an issue.  Management's handling of this concern was exactly what I would have expected.  We will definitely be back to celebrate future events or just for a quiet night out.

XATD8YVydOzi0R5Ktrz67w.text: A terrible experience, to summarize. We waited about 10 minutes to be seated while no less than three employees saw us and made me wonder if we were invisible. Then, once seated (wedged in between two tables - very uncomfortable - as there were plenty of other tables and booths where we would not have crowded other patrons)  it took about five minutes for a server to take our order (and thank God, so we thought, for putting our entire order in at once in the hopes it would expedite the lasaiz faire service we had experienced so far). I ordered a beer and my partner ordered an iced tea. 15 minutes later, our water glasses were empty and no beer or iced tea. Good thing we weren't really thirsty.   Remember those two tables around us? They were attended to no less than three times while we sat there, no water and twiddling our thumbs. That was it. We got up and walked out. Such a disappointment. We will NEVER go back there as there are plenty of other quality restaurants in the area that treat their customers much better.

V9CB4YjLXFd5ji4BiVJKlg.text: I was a little apprehensive to try Pomelo based on the bad service reviews, but our experience was far from bad and maybe they have hit their stride now.  The service from hostess station to the table staff was prompt and friendly and our water glasses and drinks were always filled, and it truly seemed like this level of service was going on at every table around us. They were steady but not packed and it was lunch time.   I had the patty melt, which was huge, super tasty, and cooked exactly like I had requested. My boyfriend had his usual... a cheese pizza.  He was really happy with it and said the crust was really really good.  I took half the patty melt home and actually ate it, which is not typical with leftovers for me they usually end up in the trash.    We will go back here for sure.  The space is small but nice, the bar area is great and has TV's and the The Orchard courtyard area is beautiful.  Parking sucks, we were luck to get a spot in the back.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing Pizza
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice oversize seating and furniture and patio seating which will be great in the cooler month, the courtyard is full of trees and misters
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patty Melt, with Fries, very good.

gbQ6MFt313X5LvIjR_G0dQ.text: This is the cutest little place!  My friend suggested us meeting here for dinner last week for our girls night and at first I was a little confused as Waze was leading me to a neighborhood.  After a moment, I realized the place was tucked away in between the neighborhood.  Pomelo shares its space with Luci's and an ice cream shop.  The middle common area is adorable with picnic tables and outside eating.  Our service at Pomelo was great.  Our server was attentive and always at an arms reach if we ever needed anything.  We ordered the brussel sprouts, chefs charcuterie board and the mexican corn to share.  The sprouts and corn were fantastic but the charcuterie board was left to be desired.  We had to ask for the fig spread and grainy mustard that should've already come with the board.  It ended up that the fig spread was the best item on the board.  For my entree, I had the shrimp fettuccine which was delicious.  It was perfectly creamy with the right amount of shrimp, which by the way, were quite a decent size. My friend ordered the spinach artichoke dip which was pretty terrible.  Another ordered the roasted chicken to which she demolished it!  I assume it must've been good.  I'd definitely come back again and try their other items and sit outside and take advantage of this amazing weather.

UqToQtYdoF4ic-a24lsR1A.text: I was visiting my best friend in Phoenix and she recommended that we try Pomelo.  The space is modern, romantic and bistro-like, playing swing music and sultry French music (in the other rooms). I can see this being a great place to celebrate an anniversary or birthday.   We sat at a corner booth facing everyone in the restaurant. We were welcomed by Brian who took our drink orders and was served mainly by Alexis who took our lunch orders but everyone on the staff was just so welcoming and jovial that we were never forgotten. The manager Chad even greeted us and asked if we needed anything!   We ordered the mushroom pizza and added broccoli (+$2) and split the house fries. Both were delicious. (I recommend asking for parmesan to top off the fries!)   Afterwards we wanted to sit in the salon/cocktail lounge for desert. We had the fig and pear cobbler a la mode which could have easily fed 4 people!  The vibe of the cocktail lounge was really classy. (You could hear more of the French music playing softly) There we met two more incredibly friendly servers (Bridgette and Monica).  The cherry on top of the whole experience was the fun little message I found tiled into the floor of the women's bathroom. I don't know if it's also in the men's room but it was just a nice touch.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The perfect proportional bite is key.
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fig and pear cobbler à la mode can feed 4 people
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Incredibly honest message in the floor in front of the vanity.

j4UImgVnxrEsybBrfi-boQ.text: Great spot. Delicious food and wine. Can't wait to go back, the service was nice and relaxed not rushed. Was there on a weeknight and think I'll give their patio a visit next time.

vnzvVuV9So_Gqp6wf6HdjQ.text: The ambience of this place is great. It's across the courtyard from Luci's. We had brunch here and the food was good. A few requests didn't come through service wise but our waitress recognized it and tried to rectify it quickly. The highlight of brunch for me was the giant cinnamon roll. It was so soft and gooey. Afterwards you can go for a stroll over to Luci's, shop for some cute novelty items, and grab ice cream or a drink to go. There is also a small wine selection in the store.

8KuhVofFBfD7wXR25E01Dg.text: This was the first time for my fiance and I. We had the calamari as a appetizer and it was cooked perfectly. She had the salmon and I had the beef short rib. The portions were huge and some of the best we've ever had. Megan was our waitress and Frankie was the Mgr and their attention to detail was second to none. Next time I'll save room for the home made gelato! The setting is family friendly and can accommodate large gatherings. Thank for your hospitality! Ralph Duran

HazJ3yN6OPn7Bm1M_YNHmg.text: Great restaurant with a beautiful setting and outdoor seating.  If you are looking for a fun and relaxing place, this is a great choice. Service has always been impeccable each time i have been. The manager is present to endure all customers are getting what they need. Food is good and simple. Nothing too creative but the meals are good.

Oc5ZKgIO0VEoLAjzIIET9A.text: Love this place! The location, the grounds, the decor! I took part in the happy hour and the pizza and wine specials. I can't say enough about the taste of the food I had. The wines were all excellent and the service was great. The only thing that would have made this a flawless review would have been the absence of the fruit flies/nats. While I understand the wine may attract these, there was quite the infestation. All in all, I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xnVwB9lE1ePn8ciCTcjBdw.text: I had brunch here and thought it was great! I got the short rib eggs benedict which was so delicious! Really cute interior and friendly waiters. Overall I'd recommend Pomelo as a delicious brunch spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short rib eggs benedict

AIX0k74AGB4QMkGdhUUw8Q.text: We held our daughter's graduation party at Pomelo/ Luci's at the Orchard and were absolutely delighted with the service and food. Linda helped us plan the party and was extremely helpful, working with us every step of the way to meet our needs! The front patio worked out great for us and was beautiful with its fireplace and lights in the trees. Our guests had a wonderful time and most remarked at what a beautiful restaurant this is and how good the food was. We will definitely hold another party at Pomelo in the future! Thank you again Linda for all your guidance & great ideas!

p2VV31PgGsbnYu_yAHrGIQ.text: Great Place! We have had dinner several times here and have never been disappointed. The best part is the service from the staff especially the bartenders, Great drinks and great conversation. Last night I had the pork chop that was done wonderfully, very thick, cooked perfectly and very juicy. the mashed potatoes and vegetable went with it very well. My wife had the rib-eye which was also cooked to perfection, very fresh and juicy. We also love the ambiance of the restaurant and they have a lovely courtyard dining area. My favorite drink is the Prickly Pear Margarita, and the other specialty drinks are very good.

5S888Cgkm-1-1balG8pjSQ.text: Ambiance and decor this place is five stars. Best way to describe would be masculine chic... If that makes any sense. Staff was friendly and kind, it has that just been opened kind of vibe and energy, hope they can keep it going.  Started with a tuna tartar to start, it was guacamole over tuna, which the silverskin was still on so it ruined the texture of the fish. All that effort and they give warmed from a bag tortilla chips, really need to make it special and give a fresh made house made chip. Sigh. Next time I'm going for street corn and pork belly.  Braised short ribs was tender and presented on a platter that was so full it was a bit much.  People would pay the same for a quality casual dining meal at half the portion they give you. Demi glace was so salty I thought they were trying to cure the short ribs after braising it. The meat was cooked well but unfortunately the demi killed it a slow salty death. It came with polenta to serve a small family and more starch... Fingerling potatoes and beans----no seasoning.... Just the oil from the pan.... So anticlimactic. BBQ pork ribs had a nice, smoke, tender, moist with a spicy sauce.... Too bad they were double stacked next to a mountain of fries and cabbage salad. Couldn't move a thing on my plate or manage to cut the ribs apart because there was so much on the platter. Fries were nice, cooked well. I think the menu says coleslaw but it's really cabbage salad.... Cabbage with Mayo based dressing. Real coleslaw usually has salt to sweat the cabbage and some vinegar perhaps for a slight pickling....give you that slight distinct tang. Unfortunately all of the above including flavor was missing.  I am so hopeful that I will return for round two because I really really like the place and I think it was a fluke or I hope it was....

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Braised short ribs with green beans, starch, and more starch
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ ribs, fries, cabbage salad

u7ll-zXFgIDYJ3JOyBYoMQ.text: Service: from start to end it was excellent.  Food: Delicious.  Partner and I both had the crispy chicken sandwich.   Portion:   umm...the chicken in the brioche bun was the equivalent of one chicken tender found at your local Fry's or Safeway.   For $13, a bit too much.   Nicely designed space for the restaurant and the "orchard" on general.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crispy chicken sandwich with seasonal vegetables.

GdB2Gd3iATrebLC1JuxwQA.text: Asked for a pizza without certain items. Server had another one made but pizza was extremely burnt. This place is in a good spot but the quality of food is just "ok".

zqtyvPsOeNUPLkEGp-l-Ug.text: Came here with my mom and kids for the first time and will definetly be coming back! I have the Blact Sandwich with a side salad w/ lemon vinaigrette.. Amazing. My kids had the cheese pizza (best kids pizza in town) and cheeseburger (fresh and cooked perfectly) and fries (crispy and creamy). Love love love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Z0XepJVaXcC_H0mkuLad8w.text: New American Chic cuisine restaurant good for date night or family night. Wonderful ambiance, nicely decorated, with an outdoor grassy area for the kids. In a small complex called The Orchard, with a coffee bar, wine bar, ice cream shop, there is something for everyone. Italian oriented food with a twist. I had pasta bolognese with sirloin steak ragu. Great. My wife had braised short ribs with polenta which was outstanding. Signature cocktails, extensive wine list, local beers on tap round out a perfect meal. Did I mention wood fired pizzas ? You do not leave hungry. Seating indoor or outdoor. Outdoor lights. I am definitely going back. Reasonable prices for a perfect night out. Entrees $15 - $35. It is hidden in a nice residential area so watch for a small sign near 12th and Glendale. I missed it twice !

duLPLWc7lTRfYKg1l9LXrg.text: My wife and I have been back here a couple of times.  The decor and ambiance is extremely attractive. It's a really nice place to spend a Saturday brunch.  Service is good, we had an attentive server and one person actually grabbed a high chair for my daughter from the sister restaurant across the yard.  The breakfast pizza is a must try, and the chilaquiles and chopped salad were also total hits with my wife.  The cinnamon roll is also one of the best I've ever had, but I'd recommend you ask to have it after your meal.  The staff is incredibly understanding and genuinely caring and they will go the extra mile to make a good experience great. We really enjoyed this place and will *definitely* be back!!

pW2ezJhdnD6ihUyKN_NSVw.text: I discovered Pomelo earlier this year when looking for a great place to take my girlfriend out to dinner. We sat on the patio and thoroughly enjoyed our evening. The ambiance and atmosphere was marvelous. Then just a week ago, I picked Pomelo as the location to host my daughter's high school graduation party. My mother and I worked with Event Coordinator Linda, and it was the best decision we could've made! Linda turned a basic graduation party into a True family and friends event for everyone we invited. We had our party in The Barn, had a personal attendant (Herbert) who did a fantastic job handling all of our needs for a party of 15. The food was excellent along with the service. Hats off to Linda and all the event planning staff at Pomelo! Me and my family will be long time customers to this True gem of a restaurant!

_rdmD95iuxnJmuzGVrttEg.text: Well it finally opened. Pomelo is a new resto by the owners of Luci's. The complex features plenty of outdoor seating with misters in a great looking courtyard. Indoors has two dining rooms and a private dining room. The bar is well set up and staff friendly. The menu features some interesting starters, great looking salads and a small assortment of house specialties that range from  ribeye to halibut and ribs to pasta. They also have some great looking pizzas. Nice jazz plays throughout. This is an upscale on the inside casual on the outside kinda place. Moderately priced with entrees ranging from 14$ to 28$. I just stopped in for a nice IPA and to check it out on opening day and cannot wait to return for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretty dining room!

QepbO2_txnhkSLMuONgmGw.text: I've eaten here several times. The atmosphere is good and it's a great place to conversation and enjoy the weather (even in the summer they have an amazing misting system). However, the food is just so so. I'll keep going back but I don't find myself thinking about the place when I'm not there.

photos.caption: Photo of Pomelo - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U52Gx08gZXvsTuDt1sLm6g.text: Great place in central Phoenix neighborhood.  Quality of food lives up to Lucy's.  Had Mussels, pizza, and salad--all of which were excellent.  Atmosphere is family-friendly.  Outdoor seating is a plenty.  No issues with parking.

pDeQbN2eUkhsk9Lpd9hAuw.text: We loved Pomelo!  The burger, the pizza and ribs were great!  The staff were all very helpful!

-PyGiQztf1iWzc9wraUcLg.text: I stopped into this place for lunch with one of my friends and our four kids because they were is no seating available at Lucy's which is a more relaxed, kid friendly environment. They did have a kids menu and high chairs so I figured it would be OK if we hey there. We ordered our drinks from our waiter, Ethan. The kids want to pink lemonade but there was none available so they were able to make Shirley Temple's. My daughter asked for some cherries and the waiter checked the bar and informed us that there were no cherries. Then I asked if they had any apple juice for my one-year-old. They did not. I decided to get the patty melt but I wanted to add some bacon to it. He checked with the kitchen to see if that will be OK and came back and informed us that I could not have bacon on my sandwich. I asked him why and he said that the kitchen did not have any bacon. I thought this was kind of strange. He never came back to give us any refills on our drinks and seemed annoyed with our requests for cherries and for kids cups since he brought the drinks in regular adult size cups and any parent knows that that is an accident waiting to happen. Then he came and asked us if we were ready to pay while we were still eating. I found this to be rude as well. My son was very fussy and at one point I got up and left the restaurant to try to calm him down. Once the food came he was quiet and an old lady walked past our table and thanked me for ruining her lunch. I assume her appetite was lost because my child was crying. To that old lady, there's a special place in hell for you. But I digress. My patty melt was OK but the patty itself was rare and he didn't ask me how I wanted it but if he had asked, I wouldn't have chosen rare. Patty was pretty thin so I don't know what the difficulty was in cooking it all the ways through. I ended up rushing to get out of this place because the overall experience was just kind a horrible from the service to the food to the other customers and to my fussy child. I would definitely not go back there. There are way too many better restaurants that I could be eating at.

NRKGtTI-Q61WDAI0FeD-Nw.text: At first I thought what a neat space this is. After our dinner I felt different, the cocktail i had was pretty average at best, we waited a long time to get our meal and our help was not very helpful with suggestions. If you are dining in this general area I would suggest somewhere else like Ladera or Richardson's. Caio.

gGkyqHqXfKl6V1CXP3b5JQ.text: Great location and the property is very cute that's the only positive thing I can say. Menu is not in keeping with the location and lacks choices. Very expensive for what you get I am guessing the prices reflect the cost of getting this new local business open.

Xeu97wdyv623KZSxHeZOnQ.text: Very disappointed today in our visit to Pomelo. We rented the green room for my mothers 86 birthday. There was 9 of us and everything started out pretty good. Our server was very nice and overall attentive to us. Some of us ordered Bloody Marys and they were very good. The appetizers were not bad, shrimp and calamari and a spinach dip and chips. Here is where our displeasure showed up 1. One of us ordered the green chili enchilada entree at about 12:15 off the brunch menu. Our waitress came back 10 minutes later and said they were out of the item, really! How many did they serve for breakfast (not sure they were even open for breakfast!). 2. 2 of us ordered the fish tacos..... very average at best, tasted like they were frozen pieces of cod dipped in hot oil. 3. The french dip, again very average, no flavor.  Our previous visit the pizza was good but the chef needs to get more creative with the menu and recipes. If we return it will be for the pizza and wine special.......unless they run out of pizza or wine. :-( Mike

nztxTDyd43d9oRMZPRixaQ.text: I had a great time there but the hostess Madison was very friendly while I waited to get seated made the experience better

SwPtHVMSwm9T16MrTCUX_g.text: I Love the concept, the grounds, the decor and the location. The menu and service is still getting the kinks worked out but I'm hopeful that this will be a wonderful staple in the neighborhood. Pizza and salads were excellent. The cocktail we ordered, not so good. We sent it back. Looking forward to coming back!

GqfP1y7xhCusuz11Da2ujw.text: First visit to Pomelo after hearing for months that it's great. Food was very good, but the overall experience was disappointing. It wasn't crowded - we arrived around 3:30 on a Sunday afternoon - but the food took forever to arrive. There are two chicken sandwiches on the menu - I ordered the grilled one, my companion ordered crispy. The chef switched the chickens - mine was crispy, with the toppings of the grilled chicken I ordered - his was grilled with the toppings he ordered. Our waitress took them away with apologies and said her manager would bring the correct dishes. Another waitress brought the new, correct orders. The manager eventually stopped by the table and said "sorry." No offer to comp or discount. We waited almost an hour for our food. Not sure we'll return.

ljXkGMiKLfT5us4nt_Pz1Q.text: Fabulous food, amazingly personal service and beautiful decor.  This is my first visit and certainly many, many more to come~

npit6GLl6Yxe63VmdsFrNQ.text: I've been to pomelo twice and was very happy with the meal.  I had the pizza, and the hamburger and both were great.  The atmosphere is just beautiful, and it blends so nicely with the neighborhood.  We are looking forward for the next building to open, to get some ice cream after dinner.  Very highly recommended.

VCGPSuIBt2bx_HBLRqEPlQ.text: We love Pomelo's! Tonight we enjoyed the pizza and bottle of wine for $20 special on Mondays and Tuesdays. Wood fired pizza from Italy! Sat at the bar and the service was great. Had gelato from Lucis across the patio for dessert. This is my 3rd time here. Last time was for birthday dinner for me and my daughter and everyone loved their dinners. Can't wait to hang out on the patio!

AL_fv24eWdIDSEglOAed-Q.text: I like what Pomelo's aspires to be.  The atmosphere and ambience are very special, like nothing else in this area. Service is top notch. The food consists of quality ingredients but could be more flavorful.  Everything we tried was bland - French dip, blakt chicken sandwich, spinach dip, calamari/shrimp, strawberry shortcake and chocolate mousse cake. Next time we'll try salad and pizza. (Although there are a LOT of pizza restaurants around here these days so it needs to be very good to compete.) The bar and lounge area is so inviting and they have one of the nicest patio seating areas around. I hope they dial in the menu and condiment/seasoning problem; if they do they'll be a top-tier north central PHX dining spot.

XJQ51Elw1hVBgnBfqcvZJA.text: I live in the neighborhood and have been waiting with anticipation for Pomelo to open.  The space is beautiful with a very family friendly vibe outside.  The burger was delicious.  The beet salad needed a bit of salt and maybe some acid.  The artichoke dip was a little on the thin side but we will be back.  My main complaint is the parking.  As I said, I live in the neighborhood and am sad to see the streets beginning to get cluttered with Pomelo customers.  Nobody likes strangers walking down their street and not leaving space for visitors of the people who live on the street to park.  I would like suggest a partnership.  Maybe Pomelo could pay the church on 12th and Glendale to use their parking lot in the evening.  It's always empty and I'm sure they wouldn't say no to a little monthly fee for using their lot.  Just a thought....

pYOpsq3SBXwXxCxMtFEz8g.text: A great new restaurant. Dinner dishes were good. I had the pork chop which was tasty but would have been better on the grill. The Halibut was quite delicious. As far as apps go the Spinach dip reminded me of Houston's dip. The restaurant had a great bar.  When crowded there should be a walk up section defined as with the crowd standing behind diners was not ideal waiting for drinks. We later discovered that the lawn does have cocktail service, hostess should make this point when giving you wait times.  All in all I will be returning to discover more.

eezKxdlgOs7FMBr03MFEiw.text: We went last night for my husband's B-DAY dinner, with another couple. Liked the way it looked, really liked the grounds and will enjoy them when a little cooler,ha.. The food was excellent! They had grapefruit sculpin IPA on tap, can't go wrong there. All in all, a delightful dining experience..

Ic9rq5Gi5XYQiohisdeL2Q.text: Great atmosphere, but the service isn't as good.  We asked for sangria, but were told they were out, so we ordered a more expensive wine.  5 minutes later we saw another table being served sangria.  We pointed it out to the waiter who then brought some to us.  The appetizer we ordered never came, even after reminding the server that we ordered it.  A beet salad also didnt arrive until we were done eating after we reminded the server for a second time.  They did not charge us for the salad due to the time it took.  The hamburger was fantastic!

mloCdRgPNys5r2UKcjtOKw.text: Tried Pomelo for the first time today for lunch. I am totally impressed and will be back often! The atmosphere was great and the service was superb. The food was delicious and for the price it felt like a steal. The entire set up at the orchard is great. It's definitely a gem in the neighborhood that I'm so glad we found. Definitely highly recommend.

mfVlCeN2nwJFUGlkFveVow.text: First I would like to say I am a fan of Luci's Healthy Marketplace, their other location. I have eaten there regularly for years and have also ordered catering with no issues whatsoever. I don't know what happened here, but I am sad to say it was awful! First of all we made a reservation and arrived a little early. There was only one table taken in the place and the hostess told us since we were early we should wait at the bar. They were open for business and plenty of tables available, why couldn't we be seated? I guess if I didn't make any reservation I could have sat right down? We were going to leave when she said "Ok, I will make an exception this one time". My husband and daughter ordered burgers, one was supposed to be medium and one medium well. They both arrived more as medium rare with a red/pink interior, yet they had a burnt flavor. Very strange. The fries were tasteless and had a hard texture as if they were not cooked enough. I had ribs which were not meaty and very dry. Also, the  tomato on my daughters burger was the end of a tomato which should be discarded not put on an expensive burger. We were all so disappointed with our meals and told them. They took one entree off the bill so I am giving two stars for their kindness for that. The greeter/hostess has a bad attitude and the food was horrible so we all said we would not go back.

vIrHmZlGbuO1XePuLsqfdA.text: great food and staff! there was a hostess named maddie when i went in not too long ago and she was very helpful and had a great smile as well!! definitely coming back.
